loans.name: Dineesha

texts.en:
Dineesha is a 28-year-old married woman living with her husband in Kekanadura, Sri Lanka. She has one son, who is in school.  She is a hard-working woman.  Dineesha manages a sewing business, which she started three years ago.  She co-operates well with others, and is very enthusiastic about her business.

She has requested a 10,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help her business by purchasing additional cloth. 

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy cloth

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Souleye

texts.fr: Monsieur Souleye D. est un jeune commerçant qui exploite du sel dans la zone de Joal situé à 37 km de Mbour . le but du prêt est l'acquisition d'une charrette et d'un cheval pour ralier les villages environnants pour la revente du sel. Cette activité lui permet de vivre avec sa famille et de pouvoir bénéficier des revenus lui permettant de faire face aux exigences de la vie
texts.en:
Mr. Souleye D. is a young businessman who trades in salt in Joal, 37km from Mbour. He aims to use this loan to acquire a horse cart to sell salt in the surrounding villages. This business allows him to live with his family and to benefit from the profits, allowing him to meet life’s demands.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To sell salt

loans.name: Torre Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Torres está conformado por tres personas trabajadoras, emprendedoras y esforsadas. La coordinadora es Martha Ercilia García Santos quien vende comida desde hace tres años con las ganancias de su negocio del mercado puso una comidería. Ella invertirá el préstamo en la compra de arroz, aceite, carne, verduras etc.

Sus compañeros de su grupo son Maricela S. quien realiza y vende dulces nicaragüenses como la cajeta de leche, de coco, piñonate, de masa, huevo chimbo y coyolito mientras Cándido José Gutiérrez pequeño buhonero de golosina las cuales distribuye en diferentes puntos del país.
texts.en:
The Las Torres (The Towers) group is made up of three hard-working people. One of them is Martha Ercilia García Santos. She has sold food for the last three years and used profits from her business in the market to set up an eatery. She will use the requested funds to buy rice, cooking oil, meat, vegetables, etc. Her fellow group members are Maricela S. who sells typical Nicaraguan sweets and Cándido José Gutiérrez who hawks snacks in various parts of the country.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains, meat, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.en:
Zoraida C. is from the village of San Antonio, Talakag Bukidnon. She is 46 years old. Zoraida is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Zoraida owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Zoraida has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Zoraida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Zoraida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Zoraida is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Zoraida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Production and sale of fritters

loans.name: God's Children Group

texts.en:
Browne P. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called God’s Children. He is 26 years old, single, and has one child who is three years old.  Browne is currently a high school student.

For two years, Browne has been selling shoes at the Red Light Market in Paynesville, which is near Monrovia, Liberia. He says he sells the shoes “in a clean environment and at a low price,” which keeps customers returning. One of the challenges he faces is that there are many competitors in the market.

Browne plans to use his 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more shoes. His goal is to expand his business and to live a healthy life.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Browne is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To purchase additional footware.

loans.name: Los Lirios Ii Group

texts.es:
El grupo Liririos II está conforman Amparo R., Susana P. y Gertrudes S. tres mujeres trabajadoras que se dedican al comercio de frutas y verduras desde hace tiempo. La coordinadora del grupo es Amparo R. de 27 años quien inicio hace tres años con el comercio de perecederos. En aquel entonces era poco lo que comercializaba actualmente tiene un pequeño tramo bien surtido.
R. pronto dará a luz a su tercer hijo el cual espera con emoción junto con su esposo y sus dos hijos de siete y cuatro años.
texts.en:
The Group Liririos II is made up of Amparo R., Susana P. y Gertrudes S. three hard working women that sell fruits and vegetables, they all have many years of experience. The coordinator of the group is Amparo R. who is 27 years old, she began three years ago in the business of selling perishables, at that time there was little to sell now she has a small, well stocked cart. She will soon give birth to her third child, which she awaits excitedly to have join she and her husband and their two children of seven and four years old.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase perishables

loans.name: Lucina Paulina

texts.es:
Lucina V. de 57 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil, su casa es de cemento solo cuenta con luz y agua pero los caminos del sector donde vive siguen siendo de tierra. Es viuda pero tiene dos hijas que ya están casadas y ya tienen hijos. 

Lucina empezó con su negocio de costura cuando su esposo murió ya que no tenía ingresos para sostener su hogar. Con sus ahorros compro una pequeña maquina de coser, y empezó a promocionarse a sus vecinos como costurera. 

En la actualidad ella tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su casa trabaja desde las 06:30 am hasta terminar su trabajo. Con el préstamo quiere comprar telas, hilos y botones para su negocio. 

En el futuro quiere que su taller sea el mas grande de su sector y que sus hijas trabajen con ella.
texts.en:
Lucina V., 57, lives in a periurban area of Paraíso de Guayaquil. Her house is cement and has electricity and running water but the streets where she lives are still unpaved. She is a widow but has two married daughters with children of their own. Lucina started her sewing business when her husband died because she had no income to support her family. She used some savings to buy a small sewing machine and started to advertise herself in the neighborhood as a seamstress. She currently has a small workshop at home and works from 6:30am until she finishes her work. She will use the funds to buy fabric, thread and buttons. In the future she would like her workshop to be the largest in the area and that her daughters work with her.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fabric, thread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Production and sale of cassava flour

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin A. is from the village of Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 49 years old. Martin is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Martin is starting a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling health & medicinal products in the local community. Martin is just starting this business.

In 2010, Martin joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Martin is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Martin from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more frozen foods and fresh fish to sell

loans.name: Mutungo Kitiko, Kampala Group

texts.en:
In the photo, N. Rosemary is the first person on the right. With twenty-one years of well-grounded experience in the teaching profession, 43-year-old Rosemary is not a content woman. At issue is the low remuneration that teachers get, she not being an exception. She has struggled to give her children a worthwhile education.

This married mother of 5, is however, not holding a negative outlook on life. In her home area of Mutungo-Kitiiko, Rosemary has quite a reputation for her teaching skills and is liked around every school she teaches in. She, however, has not achieved her dream of being head teacher in the different institutions she has moved in.

Rosemary is hopeful that this loan will help her in educating her children and also in helping her upgrade in her studies.

loans.use: To pay her children's school fees and other school financial requirements

loans.name: Afroditas Group

texts.es:
En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer Exaltación, se reúne la Asociación Comunal AFRODITAS, con 8 integrantes 

Una de las integrantes es Marina Luz de 24 años, casada y vecina de la zona Ciudad Satélite.
Marina tiene el negocio de venta de masitas, hace 3 años aproximadamente y necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos como la harina, azucar y otros.
 
Las demás integrantes de éste grupo cuentan con variados negocios como la venta de artefactos, cosméticos, tejido de chompas, venta de comida, costura de chamarras y venta de productos naturales.
 
Todas necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería o materia prima según el negocio que tengan.
texts.en:
The 8-member AFRODITAS (Aphrodites) communal association meets at one of Pro Mujer Exaltación’s focal centers. One of the members is Marina Luz, 24. She’s married and lives in Ciudad Satélite. She ha sold masitas (a typical pastry) for about three years and needs funds to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, etc. The other members of the group have various commercial activities like the sale of crafts, cosmetics, sweater knitting, food sales, jacket making and sales of natural products. They all need funds to buy ingredients or raw materials for their various businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients.

loans.name: Dina

texts.es: Dina tiene 55 años, casada, es una madre de familia muy responsable, tiene 8 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con 6 de ellos. Hace más de 32 años se dedica, a la fabricación de muebles, en donde se encarga de lijar la madera, mientras que su esposo fragmenta por grosores y medidas. Su taller está ubicado en la parte inferior de su casa, por lo que es muy reducido el espacio donde trabaja. Sus vecinos  y amigos reconocen la calidad del trabajo que realizan, ya que siendo su única fuente de ingresos, trabajan con mucho esmero para sacar adelante su familia. Disfruta mucho lo que hace, aunque a veces es difícil mantenerse en el mercado, debido a la competencia. Es por ello que mas adelante espera contar con madera en cantidad para poder trabajar sin dificultad. Este es su crédito número 32 y sabe que tiene que pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, además en su grupo comunal es una compañera muy alegre y responsable. Con el crédito que solicita, se comprará madera al por mayor, para brindar un buen acabado a sus muebles.
texts.en:
Dina is 55 years old, she is married and is the mother of a very responsible family. She has eight children, but she lives with only six of them. For more than 32 years she has built furniture, she is responsible for sanding the wood, while her husband's responsibilities are divided between weights and measures. Her shop is located in the lower part of her house, which means that there is very little space to work. Her neighbors and friends know the quality of her work. This is their only source of income and they work with great care to get ahead with their family. She really enjoys what they do, although sometimes it is difficult in the market because there is so much competition. This is why she wants to get ahead, in having a quantity of wood to be able to work with out difficulty. This is loan number 32 and she knows that they have to make repayments punctually, what's more in their community she is known as very happy and responsible. With the loan that she is seeking, she will buy wood at wholesale to provide a good finish to their furniture.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly McKinnon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood at wholesale

loans.name: Masasi Group

texts.en:
Fatuma K., age 32, is married with one child of 8 years.  She has a food business since 2006.  She works from 5am to 4pm and she is able to make a monthly profit of about $87.

This will be Fatuma’s 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase on quantity and improve on quality and she has paid back the loan successfully.  She hopes for a loan to increase on food business and also start selling charcoal.

Fatuma will share this loan with her loan Group Masasi which totals 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. 
	
In the picture, Fatuma is 4th from left in black and white blouse second row.
.

loans.use: To  increase on food business and  also  start selling charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stocking and selling corn

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
Este grupo de la zona surgió con muchas ganas y esperanza por de mejorar la calidad de vida que las mismas llevan mediante el trabajo.
Todas las señoras realizan actividades productivas como ser : venta de mercaderías comestibles, venta de ropas, venta de plásticos, fabricación y venta de ropas etc. 
Así como la señora Dionisia quien se dedica a la venta de ropas , en una tienda que posee en su domicilio.
Ella abrió su negocio después de integrar el comité de mujeres emprendedoras y se encuentra muy satisfecha con su trabajo ya que puede ayudar en algunos gastos a su familia.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropas (pantalones, remeras, camisas, vestidos, zapatos, lencería) y así podrá contar con más variados productos para ofrecer.
texts.en:
This area group grew out of the need to improve the quality of life they had through their work; they have much desire and hope for success. All of the women are involved in productive activities like: food sales, clothing sales, plastics sales, clothing manufacturing, etc. Dionisia, for example, sells clothing in a store she set up in her home. She opened her business after joining the committee of enterprising women and she is very satisfied with her work because it helps her meet some of her household’s expenses. She is asking for funds to buy clothing (pants, skirts, shirts, dresses, shoes and lingerie) in order to have a more varied stock to offer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted clothing items.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 55 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 5 hijos, del que solo vive en su casa propia con su hija Mary que estudia en la Universidad. El negocio al que se dedica Rosa, es la venta de salchipapas (papas y pollo frito), por lo que empieza a partir de las 5 de la tarde hasta las 12 de la noche,  trabajando arduamente, friendo y vendiendo sus platillos. Desde entonces su puesto de salchipapas lo realiza en la puerta de su casa atendiendo a sus clientes, resultándole muy rentable el negocio. Generalmente trabaja sola, pero los fines de semana su hija mary la apoya. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y darles un trato cordial; es así que lleva 5 años en esta labor, sólo que a veces no termina de vender todo; y pierde parte de su capital. En el futuro planea incrementar  mesas y sillas para ofrecer mayor comodidad a sus clientes. Este es su crédito número 32 y se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas. Además en su grupo comunal es un cliente risueño. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará una parrillero y toldo para ofrecer una mejor atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa, 55, is a very hard-working woman. She has 5 children but only her daughter Mary, who is a university student, still lives at home with her. Rosa sells salchipapas (fried chicken and potatoes) from 5pm until midnight. She works hard frying and selling her dishes. Her food stand is located at her doorstep and the business is quite profitable. She usually works alone but her daughter Mary helps out on weekends. What she likes best about her work is chatting with her customers and treating them cordially. She has been in this line of work for 5 years. Sometimes, she doesn’t sell out all her product and incurs a loss. For the future, she would like to increase the number of tables and chairs to offer her customers more comfort. This is her 32nd loan and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion. She is a cheerful member of her communal group. She plans to use the requested funds to buy a grill and a tarp cover to provide better customer care.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a grill and a tarp cover for her stall.

loans.name: Rhegielon

texts.en:
Rhegielon T. is from the village of Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 27 years old and is single. To make a living, Rhegielon owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a buying and selling business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from collecting and buying scrap metals and plastics from the neighboring village and selling scrap metal & other used products in the local community. Rhegielon has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rhegielon joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rhegielon is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used as additional working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rhegielon from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of his family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Priyadarshani

texts.en:
Priyadarshani is a 26-year-old married woman living in Kekanadura, Matara. Her husband works as a conductor. She has three children: two daughters and one son.  All three children are in school. Priyadarshani has been managing a business selling clothes, which she started six months ago.

She has asked for a 20,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to further develop her business.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stocking and sale of corn and cassava flour

loans.name: Virgen De Bronce (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco Comunal  Virgen de Bronce lo encontramos en  la ciudad de Cuenca ubicada al sur del Ecuador  a una altura de 2500 msnm. La ciudad es la capital cultural y deportiva del país, además es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad por la UNESCO, Cuenca es considerada por los ecuatorianos como la ciudad más bella por sus paisajes naturales y sus ríos  Tomebamba, Yanuncay, Machángara y Tarqui que bañan la urbe cuencana, posteriormente se unen formando el río Paute que desembocará en el río Amazonas el más caudaloso del mundo. Este banco está  formado por mujeres que se encuentran en la lucha cada día para tener un mejor futuro y tratar de entregar  mejores días a sus familias.

La señora Norma B. vive en  el sector Virgen de  Bronce, tiene 30 años de edad, se encuentra casada y fruto de su unión ha concebido dos hijos quienes se encuentran de 10 y 8 años estudian en una escuela de la ciudad, su esposo es de profesión albañil, con esfuerzo y sacrificio han logrado construir su casa propia.

Norma se dedica a la cría y venta de pollos pelados y entrega a sus clientes en el mercado 27 de Febrero, actividad que la viene realizando hace cinco  años, este es  su primer crédito en la fundación  motivada por su mamá y hermana que son integrantes del mismo, con el dinero de su crédito va a comprar más pollos, alimento  para seguir incrementando  su negocio.

Su meta es estudiar belleza y obtener su titulo de estilista.

Gabriela F. también es socia de éste  banco hace tres ciclos motivada a formar parte de este grupo de mujeres luchadoras y emprendedoras por su suegra,  se graduó  como estilista y trabaja en esta actividad desde sus  18 años, siendo su horario de 9 a.m. hasta las 7 p.m. de lunes a viernes.

Gabriela tiene 24 años vive en unión libre y ha concebido dos  hijos quienes se encuentran de 5 y 1 año, su primer hijo estudia  en un jardín de infantes de la ciudad, su esposo es de profesión electricista, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus suegros, con su nuevo crédito va a compra víveres para su hogar, su meta es llegar a tener su propio gabinete de belleza.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Virgen de Bronce” can be found in the city of Cuenca, which is in southern Ecuador and stands 2500 meters above sea level. The city is the cultural and sports capital of the country. In addition, it was named a World Heritage Site by UNESCO. Ecuadorians consider Cuenca to be the most beautiful city because of its natural landscapes and the surrounding rivers such as the Tomebamba, Yanuncay, Machángara, and Tarqui. They all merge to form the Paute River, which flows into the Amazon, the largest river in the world. The Communal Bank consists of women who strive each day to build a better future and bring about improvements in their families.

Norma B. lives in the “Virgen de Bronce” sector. She is 30 years old, married, and has two children (ages 10 and 8) who attend school in the city. Her husband is a bricklayer by profession. With great effort and sacrifice, Norma and her husband were able to build their own home.

Norma raises chickens and sells them plucked to her customers at the February 27th Market. She has been in this business for five years. Her mother and sister, who are also members of the Communal Bank, convinced her to apply for her first loan with the Foundation. The proceeds from her loan will be used to buy more chickens and poultry feed so that she can increase her business. Her goal is to study cosmetology and become a licensed beauty stylist.

Gabriela F. is also a member of this Communal Bank and has participated in three loan cycles. Her mother-in-law convinced her to join this group of determined enterprising women. She graduated from cosmetology school and has been working as a stylist since she was 18. Gabriela works from 9am to 7pm, Monday through Friday. She is 24 years old, in a common law marriage, and has two children (ages 5 and 1). Her oldest child attends kindergarten in the city, while her husband works as an electrician. She does not own a home, so she lives with her in-laws. With her new loan, Gabriela will buy provisions for her home. Her goal is to open her own beauty parlor.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens & poultry feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more crates of drinks to sell

loans.name: Nevaditas Group

texts.es:
En el Centro Focal Exaltación, se reúnen cada dos semanas la Asociación Comunal NEVADITAS. Se agruparon hace 4 años aproximadamente, por la necesidad de contar con un capital que les permita fortalecer sus negocios.

Una de las integrantes es Carmen A. de 29 años desde hace 5 años se dedica a la costura de chamarras tratando siempre de mejorar su productos y necesita el préstamo para comprar materia prima.

Las demás integrantes de este grupo tienen variaos actividades económicas como la venta de productos lácteos, costura de deportivos, venta de comida (pitzza y salteñas), venta de carne, ropa, masitas yt ienda de ferretería.

Todas necesitan el préstamo para invertir en sus negocios
texts.en:
The Communal Association “Nevaditas” (Light Snowfalls) meets every two weeks at the Exaltación Community Center. This group was started approximately four years ago as a result of the need to acquire capital to strengthen their businesses.

One of the members is Carmen A., who is 29 years old and has been manufacturing jackets for the past five years. She is always trying to improve her products and needs a loan to buy raw materials.

The other members of this group have different business activities such as selling dairy products, manufacturing sportswear, selling food (pizza and turnovers), selling clothing, selling snacks, and managing a hardware store.

They all need this loan to invest in their businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making jackets

loans.name: Florenda

texts.en:
Florenda M. is from the village of Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 46 years old. Florenda is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Florenda owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling health & medicinal products like Fern C vitamins and other food supplements in the local community. Florenda has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Florenda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florenda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Florenda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Florenda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
Francisco Javier S. de 31 años es artesano de calzado el cual aprendió este oficio en su juventud trabajando en distintos talleres lo cual le ayudo a perfeccionar su trabajo. Luego de ello se independizo y empezó a prestar para ir forjando su taller con mejores condiciones.
S. son el crédito compra materiales como cuero, cuerina, Brasil, plantillas, suelas, pegas, hilo etc. para fabricar sandalias y zapatos que su esposa lleva a comercializar.
texts.en:
Francisco Javier S. is 31 years old and a craftsman who makes shoes. He learned this profession in his youth by working at different shops which helped him to perfect his skills. Francisco later became independent and opened his own workshop that has better conditions.

He will use this loan to buy materials such as natural leather, synthetic leather, brazilwood, insoles, soles, adhesives, thread, and other items used in making sandals and shoes that his wife will sell.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Production and sale of cassava flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying corn

loans.name: Maria Onorina

texts.es:
La Sra. María F.  es cliente recurrente de la Fundación Paraguaya está casada con el Señor Calixto C.  padres de siete hijos, domiciliados en el Km 4 ½. Ella trabaja en su negocio denominada  Che La Reina, donde tienen una despensa  lo cual le genera importantes ingresos para su familia. El Señor Calixto se dedica a la venta de sombrillas,  el viaje hasta la Ciudad de Salto del Guaira donde tiene una clientela ya formada, se tratan de personas muy trabajadoras que consiguieron un importante crecimiento junto a la Fundación Paraguaya.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderias para su negocio así como; arroz, fideos, azucar, panificados, lacteos, enlatados.
texts.en:
Sra. María F. is a repeat client of Fundación Paraguaya. She is married to Sr. Calixto C. and they are the parents of seven children. They reside at Km 4½. María manages a grocery store called “Che La Reina”, which generates significant income for her family. Sr. Calixto sells umbrellas and travels to the city of Salto del Guaira where he has an established clientele. They are hardworking people who have achieved significant growth by partnering with Fundación Paraguaya.

María is requesting a loan in order to buy merchandise for her business such as rice, noodles, sugar, baked goods, dairy products, and canned goods.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchadise for her store

loans.name: Margot

texts.es:
Margot tiene 64 años, tiene un hijo y vive en la ciudad de Urubamba. Ella es natural de la ciudad de Apuricma. Su principal actividad económica es la venta de ropa en el mercado modelo de Urubamba, ella actualmente tiene un espacio en el pasadizo del mercado donde vende sus productos. Ya son 16 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. 

Margot pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal tiene 8 años de funcionamiento. Margot es fundadora del banco comunal y su primer crédito fue de 100 dólares.  

Margot es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su nieto. Su nieto está estudiando en la universidad la carrera profesional de administración, ella requiere el crédito para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo medias, calzoncillos, polos y muchas cosas más. 

Margot se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Margot is 64 years old and the mother of one child. She lives in the city of Urubamba, but is a native of Apuricma. Her main business activity is selling clothes at the standard market in Urubamba. She currently has a space in the corridor of the market where she sells her products. Margot has been in this business for 16 years and has done very well.

Margot is a member of the Communal Bank “Sayhua”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa. This Communal Bank has been operation for eight years. She is a founder of this Communal Bank and her first loan was in the amount of 100 dollars.

Margot is a hardworking and enterprising woman who looks at each moment as an opportunity to succeed and strives each day to help her grandson, who is studying at the university to earn a professional degree in management. She needs a loan to buy merchandise such as socks, undershirts, polo shirts, and many other items.

Margot is grateful for this opportunity and promises to complete her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Women Of Victory Group

texts.en:
Felicia F. is the leader of the group of five borrowers called Women of Victory. She is 27 years old, married, and has two children who are 6 and 2 years old. Felicia is a high school graduate.

For two years, Felicia has been selling charcoal at the Red Light Market, which is near Monrovia, Liberia. She says that she meets the demands of her customers, which keeps them returning.

Felicia plans to use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 29,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more charcoal. Her dream is to increase the size of her business and educate her children.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Felicia is the one holding the sign.

loans.use: To purchase additional charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Sergio Antonio

texts.es:
Don Sergio es un hombre trabajador de edad de 41 años, vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos, su negocio es una pizzería en donde vende los ricos calzones de pan, pues hace varios años logro hacer su propio negocio ya que tenía la experiencia por que trabajo en una pizzería. Así como también trabajo de albañil, panificador, para llevar el sustento de su familia. Ahora con su esposa atienden  junto el negocio pues no solo pizza vende.
Vende chorizo en el mercado el cual el mismo lo hace por que tiene un molino en donde el muele la carne  y hace cereal pues para el mover el dinero es obtener mejores resultado en su economía. Con este financiamiento comprara cerdos, y materia prima para hacer mas grande el negocio de elaboración de chorizo y entregar al mercado. Entre sus planes es lograr mejorar el local de su negocio para dar una mejor visión a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Don Sergio is a hardworking gentleman who is 41 years old and lives with his wife and two children. He has a pizzeria where he sells delicious baked calzones. It took him several years to establish his own business. Prior to that, he gained experience working at another pizzeria. Sergio also works as a mason and a baker in order to support his family. Now his wife manages the business so that they do not have to rely on just selling pizza.

Sergio sells chorizo sausage at the market. He also owns a mill that he uses to grind meat and process grain so that he can generate extra income to improve his finances. Sergio will use this loan to buy pigs and raw materials needed to expand his sausage business. His plans include improving the location of his business so that his customers will have better visibility.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pigs & supplies for making sausage

loans.name: Querube De María

texts.es:
Querube de María Martínez J. es una mujer con visión, trabajadora y con deseo de autosuperarse.  Ella inicio con la floristería luego de haber participado en un curso de floristería donde la meta del proyecto era que cada uno de los participantes pusiera su propio negocio. 
Este conforme el tiempo y la inversión han ido creciendo poco a poco. Además cabe mensionar que las metas de Martínez son culminar su carrera universitaria en Química y Farmacia y mejorar su floristería es por ello que el crédito lo invertirá en pedestales y otros materiales que necesita.
texts.en:
Querube de María Martínez J. is a hardworking woman who has vision and a desire for self-improvement. She opened a floral shop after taking a flower arranging course in which the goal for each of the participants was to start a business.

Over time, her investment has grown little by little. It should be mentioned that Querube’s ambitions include finishing her college degree in both chemistry and pharmacy studies and improving her floral shop. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to purchase pedestals and other necessary materials for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pedestals & other materials

loans.name: Linda Flor Group

texts.es:
En uno de los Centros Focales de Pro Mujer Exaltación, se reúne la Asociación Comunal LINDA FLOR, con 8 integrantes 

Una de las integrantes es Sandra M. de 29 años, es soltera y tiene el negocio de venta de productos de belleza hace 10 años aproximadamente, cuenta con un lugar de venta propio en la Ceja de la ciudad de El Alto y necesita el préstamo para adquirir mercadería.

Las demás integrantes de éste grupo cuentan con variados negocios como la venta de material escolar, comida, condimentos, verduras, víveres, cosméticos y abarrotes.

Todas necesitan el préstamo para comprar mercadería ya que todas tienen negocios de comercialización.
texts.en:
The Communal Association “Linda Flor” (Beautiful Flower) meets at one of the Community Centers of Pro Mujer Exaltación. The group consists of eight members.

One of the members is Sandra M.. She is 29 years old, single, and has been in the business of selling beauty products for approximately ten years. Sandra has her own retail location in La Ceja in the city of El Alto. She needs a loan in order to acquire merchandise.

The remaining members of the group have various businesses selling school supplies, food, condiments, vegetables, provisions, cosmetics, and groceries. They need a loan to buy merchandise since they all have retail businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 56 años, casada, vive con sus 2 hijos ya mayores de edad y con su padre en su casa propia. Hace mas de 15 años se dedica a la compra y venta de productos nutricionales, mientras que su esposo trabaja en el extranjero, proveyéndole cada quince días este producto, convirtiéndose así en la distribuidora principal. Cada vez que los comerciantes minoristas acuden a su domicilio, casi siempre la orienta de cómo debe llegar al cliente y al visitar a sus fieles compradores, ella le indica la manera de usar adecuadamente de la mercadería, por lo que disfruta mucho lo que hace. En el futuro planea ampliar su negocio en otros distritos aledaños. Este es su dieciseisavo crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a seguir siendo puntual con sus pagos. Asimismo dentro de su grupo solidario, es la secretaria y es muy entregada a sus funciones. Con el crédito que solicita, invertirá en el incremento de estos productos nutricionales, puesto que sabe, cuanto más capital de trabajo más serán sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Juana is 56 years old, married, and lives in her own home with her father and two adult children. For more than 15 years she has been buying and selling nutritional products. Meanwhile, her husband works abroad and sends her products every two weeks. This has allowed her to become one of the top distributors.

Every time she conducts a sales orientation in her home, she instructs the participants on how to reach out to the customer and conduct visits with their loyal clientele. Juana demonstrates how the merchandise should be properly used in order to maximize the enjoyment of its benefits. In the future, she plans to expand her business into other neighboring districts.

This is her sixteenth loan with MFP and she promises to remain punctual with her payments. Juana also serves as the secretary of her solidarity group, so she is very dedicated to her duties. With the loan she requested, Juana will increase her supply of nutritional products since more operating capital translates into more earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase nutritional products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Lend A Helping Hand, Kampala Group

texts.en:
N. Sarah is a single woman with three children. She operates her two-year-old retail shop along Ben Kiwanuka Street in Kampala.

One of Sarah’s major challenges in the course of operating her shop has been the unsteady prices of most of her small-scale goods. This has, to all intents and purposes, compelled her to make discounts on goods as most of her competitors keep their prices low deliberately to allure customers.

Sarah operates on a monthly profit of 170,000 shillings, being that she operates in a metropolis. Her dream is to expand her business, notwithstanding these minimal earnings. She figures that, with this loan, she will be able to go wholesale as she will have ready money to buy more general-store stock.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for her general store

loans.name: Merilyn

texts.en:
Merilyn C. is from the village of Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 36 years old. Merilyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Merilyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products including fish, dried fish, and shrimp in the local community through peddling. Merilyn has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Merilyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She had successfully paid the previous loan of 5,000 Php from HSPFI. This loan was used as additional working capital for her buy and sell business. Merilyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Merilyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying teak seeds

loans.name: San Joaquin Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Joaquín está integrado por cuatro personas trabajadoras. El coordinador del grupo es el señor Pablo Ricardo P. Silva quien vende granos básicos desde hace siete años junto a su esposa.  
Sus compañeros de grupo son José Aviluz Arias B. quien vende ropa y zapatos, Tania Liseth R. M.  que comercializa prendas de oro y plata y Santiago Felipe S. Áreas comerciante de productos varios.
texts.en:
The San Joaquín Group consists of four hardworking individuals. The group coordinator is Sr. Pablo Ricardo P. Silva, who has been selling basic grains with his wife for seven years.

His fellow group members are José Aviluz Arias B. who sells clothing and shoes, Tania Liseth R. M. who sells gold and silver jewelry, and Santiago Felipe S. Áreas who sells various products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains

loans.name: Sandra Micaela

texts.es:
Sandra García de 34 años, vive en una zona periurbana  en la Perimetral (lugar muy humilde, las casas del sector están rodeadas de un estero donde pasan los barcos con cargamento pesado) de Guayaquil. Su casa es de cemento y cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Es madre soltera con un hijo de 11 años que estudia en una escuela fiscal. 

Sandra inicio el negocio de comidas típicas del Ecuador hace 4 meses con ayuda de su mama, en un local alado de su casa, vende arroz con pollo, tallarines y su especialidad es arroz con menestra y todo tipo de apanados de carnes. Todos los días a las 06h00 am comprar los víveres para la comida en el mercado. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, cajas de aceite, ollas para su negocio de comidas típicas. En el futuro quiere tener otros locales de comida.
texts.en:
Sandra García is 34 years old. She lives in the outskirts of Guayaquil, along the Perimetral (ring road), in a very humble area. The houses in this district are surrounded by a stream where ships with heavy cargo pass by. Her house is made of cement and has all the basic services. She is a single mother with a son of 11, who attends public school. Sandra began her business selling typical foods of Ecuador four months ago, with the help of her mother, in a place next to her house. She sells chicken with rice, noodles, and her specialties -- rice with vegetable stew and all kinds of meat empanadas. Every day at 6 am, she buys the ingredients for the food in the market. With the loan, she wants to buy rice, tins of oil, and pots for her business of typical foods. In the future, she wants to have other locations to sell food.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, tins of oil, pots

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase additional used clothes.

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: Monsieur Mamadou G. est un chauffeur qui gére un mini car pour le transport un commun vers la liaison Mbour Kaolack une autre région du Sénégal . Le but de son crédit est la réparation de son vehicule pour l'achat d'un moteur d'occasion lui permettant de reprendre l'activité qui est le sien . Ainsi monsieur G. père de 6 enfants depend de ce vehicule pour nourrire sa famille et s'occuper à bien de leur éducation
texts.en:
Mr. Mamadou G. is a driver who runs a mini van for public transport towards the Mbour Kaolack line in another region of Senegal. The aim of his credit is for the repair of his vehicle for the purchase of a new second-hand engine which will allow him to take on again his business. Thus, Mr. G., the father of 6 children depend on this vehicle to feed his family and to take good care of their education.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repair

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
Albertina tiene 45 años de edad, es soltera y vive sola en el caserío Lagunas, una zona rural perteneciente al distrito de Mórrope de la provincia de Lambayeque, la zona se encuentra ubicada a una hora y quince minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de 20 años a la crianza y comercalización de animales menores para obtener los recursos que necesita para mantenerse. Ella cría aves de corral en unos corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su vivienda. Cuando estas ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo las ofrece a venta a los negociantes de la zona que a su vez los revenden en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Esta actividad le permite también sentirse activa, a pesar de que vive sola, las viviendas cercanas son habitadas por sus familiares, entre ellos se apoyan mutuamente. Precisamente sus familiares le están animando a ampliar su negocio con la compra de algunas aves pequeñas y de alimento balanceado para su correcto desarrollo, de modo que ella pueda percibir mas ganancias y salir adelante poco a poco, por este motivo ella se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Albertina es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, ella gusta mucho de sentirse útil y ayudar a los demas; en la comunidad donde vive sus conocidos le consideran una mujer tranquila y de confianza. Su mayor anhelo es hacer algunas mejoras en su vivienda de material rústico, ya que las pasadas lluvias han hecho algunos daños en su estructura.
texts.en:
Albertina is 45 years old and single. She lives alone in the small community of Lagunas, a rural area in the district of Mórrope, in Lambayeque province. The area is located one hour and fifteen minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For more than 20 years she has made a living raising and selling small animals, which has given her the means that she needs to live. She raises poultry in some pens that are situated behind her home. When the birds have grown to a good size she sells them to businesspeople in the area; they in turn resell the birds at the wholesale market in the city of Chiclayo. This activity also allows Albertina to stay active, since she lives alone, though her closest neighbors are her relatives, and all of them support each other. Her relatives are encouraging her to expand her business by purchasing some small birds and balanced feed so that they can grow properly; that way she will be able to earn more profits and get ahead little by little. That is the reason why Albertina is asking for her first loan from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa—a loan of 1000 soles that will help her to achieve her goal. Albertina is a hard-working woman who really likes to feel useful and to help others; in the community where she lives she is known to be an easygoing and responsible woman. Her greatest desire is to make some more improvements to her home using basic materials, since the recent rains have caused structural damage to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing small birds and balanced feed for expanding her business of raising and selling poultry.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia, tiene 38 años, es casada, tiene tres hijos y vive en la ciudad de Urubamba. Su principal actividad económica es la venta de comida, ella actualmente tiene un restaurante alquilado donde prepara desayuno, almuerzo, cena y comida ha pedido del cliente. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA” de la Asociación Arariwa y ella hace 6 años que participa en el banco comunal. Actualmente, ella requiere el crédito para comprar insumos como por ejemplo azúcar, arroz, fideos, verduras, carne y muchas cosas más. El banco comunal tiene 8 años de funcionamiento. 

Celia es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios de pre - grado. El anhelo de la socia es sacar profesionales a sus hijos.  

Celia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Celia is 38 years old. She is married, has three children, and lives in the city of Urubamba. Her main economic activity is selling food. She rents a restaurant where she makes breakfast, lunch, dinner, and special-order food. She belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s “Sayhua” communal bank. She is needs a loan to buy ingredients such as sugar, rice, noodles, vegetables, meat, and many other things. The communal bank has existed for 8 years. Celia is a hardworking and entrepreneurial woman who looks for every opportunity to get ahead. With her daily hard work she helps her children with their studies. Her greatest wish is for her children to become professionals. Celia is grateful for the opportunity granted her through this program and she promises to repay within the timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Celia needs the loan to buy ingredients such as sugar, rice, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Business People Group

texts.en:
Paul D. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called Business People. He is 44 years old, married with 4 children who range from 10 to 18 years old. He also cares for a sibling. Paul is a high school graduate but could not continue education through college due to lack of support.

For 2 years he has been selling mobile phone rechargeable cards and exchanging local currency to United States Dollars at the Jacob Town Chicken Farm in Paynesville, Liberia. Paul started business with help from his father who gave him some money to do business.

He faces a problem because of other competitors who do business close to his business site. Paul keeps his business environment clean in order to keep customers returning. His goal and dream is to expand his business into other communities. Paul needs this loan to purchase more rechargeable cards and increase the size of his business.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Paul is holding the sign.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable cards and increase his business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To puchase phone recharge cards.

loans.name: Rafiki Mwema Group

texts.fr:
Jean-Claude N. est un commerçant âgé de 30 ans. Il habite la Commune urbaine de Kamenge (Bujumbura-Mairie).  Lui et son épouse sont détenteurs des Diplômes des Humanités à l’école secondaire, respectivement en section scientifique et en humanités techniques.  Il vend les produits cosmétiques et gère un restaurant au Marché de Kamenge tandis que sa femme n’a pas encore trouvé du travail qui correspond à sa formation de technicienne en informatique.  Il a commencé son business depuis 2004 juste à la sortie de l’école.  Turame est venu pour lui faciliter d’étendre ses activités, dit-il.

Il est père de 3 enfants ; 2 jumelles ainées qui ont maintenant 5 ans et 1 nourrisson garçon âgé d’un mois.  Les deux jumelles étudient en section maternelle. Il souhaiterait que ses enfants finissent leurs études en Médecine pour soigner les gens. 

Il demande le crédit Kiva pour augmenter la quantité de ses achats en produits de beauté mais aussi accroitre son volume d’activités de son restaurant pour ainsi augmenter ses revenus. Cela lui permettra de répondre à ses besoins quotidiens de ration alimentaire, la scolarisation de ses enfants et faire des épargnes.  Il a l’espoir que son métier de commerçant lui permettra de mener une vie heureuse et réussie.  

Il préfère Turame aux autres IMFs et Banques par son taux d’intérêt le plus bas et son échéance du crédit la plus longue.  Il est maintenant au 6e Cycle avec son groupe Rafiki Mwema qui veut dire en français « Bel ami. »
texts.en:
Jean-Claude N. is a businessman, aged 30. He lives in a township of Kamenge (Bujumbura-Mairie). He and his wife both have humanities degrees from secondary school, scientific section and technical humanities respectively. He sells cosmetics and manages a restaurant in the Kamenga market, whereas his wife has not yet found work corresponding to her degree in computer sciences. Jean-Claude began his business in 2004, right when he graduated from high school. Turame came along and allowed him to extend his businesses, he says. He is the father of three children, twins aged five and a little boy of one month. The twins are in kindergarten. He would like his children to finish medical school so that they can care for people. Jean-Claude is requesting a Kiva loan to be able to buy more cosmetics and also to bolster his restaurant business so as to increase his income. This will allow him to feed his family, pay school fees for his children, and still have some savings. He is hopeful that his businesses will allow him to live a happy and successful life. Jean-Claude prefers Turame to other MFIs and banks because of its low interest rate and its longer term loans. He is now on his sixth loan with his group 'Rafiki Mwema' which translates as "Fine Friend".

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase his inventory of cosmetics and expand his restaurant business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying seeds and work tools

loans.name: Erika

texts.es: Erika tiene 35 años, casada y madre de 2 hijos, aún pequeños y juntos viven en su casa propia. Hace más de 3 años se dedica a la venta de ropa y calzado, por lo que tiene que alternar este trabajo con sus labores domesticas, es así que su actividad empieza ofreciendo su mercadería a sus amigos y demás vecinos de su barrio. Ella tiene varios clientes, que saben y conocen la calidad de prendas que ofrece y no dudan en comprarle. Disfruta mucho lo hace, y mas cuando deja el producto a crédito, por luego el pago sería más de lo que costó inicialmente.  Sin embargo, algunas veces perdió cuando alguno de sus clientes nunca le llegó a pagar. Por ahora tiene el propósito de continuar vendiendo sus prendas y aumentar sus rentas, ya que su gran anhelo es comprarse un puesto en el mercado donde pueda vender mucho más. Este es su onceavo crédito con MFP, por lo que seguirá siendo puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Asimismo en su grupo solidario es una compañera muy responsable. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más prendas de vestir de exclusivos modelos, aquellos que tiene mayor demanda en el mercado.
texts.en:
Erika is 35 years old. She is married and is the mother of two children, who are still small. They live together in their own house.

For more than 3 years, she has sold clothing and shoes. Because she has to alternate this work with her household chores, she began this activity by offering her merchandise to her friends and other neighbors in her area. She has various customers, who know and recognize the quality of the goods that she offers and don't hesitate to buy from her. She very much enjoys what she does, even more when she sells on credit, because then the payment will be more than what it cost initially. Nevertheless, sometimes she loses when one of her customers never finishes paying her. For now, she intends to continue to sell her goods and increase her income, since her great wish is to buy a stall in the market where she could sell much more.

This is her eleventh loan with MFP, so she will continue being punctual with her payments. At the same time, she is a very responsible member of her community bank. With the loan that she is applying for, she will buy more clothing of exclusive styles, which have high demand in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Tubulwanise Group, Kampala

texts.en:
K. Jennifer is third from left in the photo. She is a 43-year-old married mother of six who runs a craft and firewood business in Naluvule in Kampala.

Jennifer has been plying her business for the last ten years and it is with profits from this that she has managed to shoulder her family responsibilities. All her children are in school and she is also taking care of an orphan.

Jennifer’s major challenge over the years has been clients who take most of her items on credit. In a way this has retarded her progress. Her strong reserves of hard work have, however, helped her overcome this. As it is now she is making a modest 60,000 shillings a month.

The future of her business will improve, Jennifer says, if she can obtain this loan. She plans on buying more indigenous, oriental and other foreign art crafts for her shop.

loans.use: To purchase more art craft items for her business

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana, tiene 39 años, es casada, tiene tres hijos y vive en la ciudad de Urubamba. Su principal actividad económica es la venta de frutilla en el mercado modelo de Urubamba. Ella sale a vender la frutilla los días lunes, viernes y domingos. Sus actividades económicas complementarias son la venta de maíz blanco y la venta de chicha. Ella vende chicha los días lunes, jueves  y sábados en su domicilio. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA” de la Asociación Arariwa y ella hace 6 años que participa en el banco comunal. Actualmente, ella requiere el crédito para comprar maíz blanco. Ella nos cuenta que sus clientes se encuentran satisfechos y contentos con los productos que compran.   

Susana es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios de pre - grado. El anhelo de la socia es sacar profesionales a sus hijos y juntar capital para su vejez.    

Susana se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Susana is 39 years old. She is married, has three children, and lives in the city of Urubamba. Her main business is selling strawberries in Urubamba’s Mercado Modelo. She sells the strawberries on Mondays, Fridays, and Sundays. She also sells white corn and chicha [a traditional corn-based beverage]. She sells chicha from her home on Mondays, Thursdays, and Saturdays. She belongs to Asociación Arariwa’s “Sayhua” communal bank and she has participated in it for 6 years. She needs the loan to buy white corn. She tells us that her customers are satisfied and content with the products they buy. Susana is a hardworking and entrepreneurial woman who looks for every opportunity to get ahead and works hard every day to help her children with their studies. Her greatest wishes are for her children to become professionals and to save for her retirement. Susana is grateful for the opportunity granted to her through this program and promises to repay according to the timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Susana needs the loan to buy white corn.

loans.name: Evelyn Ivanna

texts.es:
Evelyn I. de 28 años, vive en una zona periurbana en la Perimetral (lugar muy humilde, las casas del sector están rodeadas de un estero donde pasan los barcos con cargamento pesado) de Guayaquil. Su esposo es vendedor de mercadería en una empresa aun ellos no tiene hijos. 

Evelyn y su esposo se conocieron en una tienda de recargar tintas a impresoras, cuando se casaron no podían estar juntos en las tienda por políticas de ese lugar, fue hay cuando decidieron renunciar y utilizar sus ahorros para comprar tintas y envases pastitos para vender a sus conocidos. 

Su esposo obtuvo otro trabajo y ella se quedo sola atendiendo el negocio de tintas, ella comprar los galones de tintas negras, roja y verde y los llena en envases pequeños para repartirlos de Cyber. Por eso con el préstamo quiere comprar más tintas y envases para tener más ingresos y poder comprar un carro con su esposo. 

En el futuro quiere tener un local de tintas en el centro de Guayaquil ya que es un lugar muy comercial.
texts.en:
Evelyn I. is 28 years old and she lives on the outskirts of Guayaquil near the Perimetral highway (a very poor area; the houses of the area are surrounded by a stream where boats pass with heavy cargo). Her husband sells merchandise at a company and they don’t have children yet. Evelyn and her husband met at a printer ink re-fill store. When they got married, they couldn’t work together at the store because of the store’s policies. So, they decided to quit and used their savings to buy ink and plastic containers to sell to people they knew. Her husband got a new job while she tented to the ink business. She buys gallons of black, red, and green ink and then fills small containers to sell them from Cyber. With this loan she wants to buy more ink and containers so she can have more income and to be able to buy a car with her husband. In the future she wants to have an ink shop in the center of Guayquil because there is a lot of commerce there.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ink and plastic containers

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 39 years old and married with five children. Her children attend school and this gives her joy. Her husband is a businessman and he also supports their home. She is a hardworking woman selling for long hours to help her husband meet the basic needs of the family. She sells sarongs. In Nigeria, sarongs are worn mostly by women and ladies at various ceremonies like weddings. 

Stella is requesting a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es:
Doña Rosa Argentina es una mujer emprendedora, de 57 años de edad, con una familia de tres hijos, y su esposo. Su negocio es una variedad, de productos como: venta de tropigas, frijoles cocidos, alquiler de cuartos, a demás recibe remesa de una hija que tiene en el extranjero, en donde con estas ha logrado la inversión de su negocio, su esposo vende y compra oro, lo cual ha permitido el desarrollo y crecimiento del mismo.
Su casa es de concreto y logrado las mejoras gracias a las ganancias de sus ventas. Con este financiamiento comprara materiales para poner cielo raso y así evitar la alta temperatura. Contenta por que gracias a los esfuerzos de su familia y el financiamiento obtendrá mejor comodidad en su vejez
texts.en:
Doña Rosa Argentina is an empresarial woman of 57 years old. She has a family of 3 children and her husband. Rosa has a varied business, such as selling gas and cooked beans, and renting out rooms. She also receives a remittance from one of her daughters, who lives overseas. With this help Rosa has been able to invest in her business. Her husband buys and sells gold, which has also permitted her to develop and grow her business. Rosa's house is made from concrete and she has been able to make improvements to it thanks to her sales. With this loan she will purchase materials to put a ceiling in and avoid the high temperatures. Rosa is content because thanks to the efforts of her family and this loan she will have better comfort in her old age.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying flour

loans.name: José Joel

texts.es:
José es un padre de familia de 24 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el caserío San Pedro de Sasape, un sector Rural del distrito de Illimo, en la provincia de Lambayeque, el caserío se encuentra ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace aproximadamente cinco años a la crianza y venta de animales, el cría cerdos de raza criolla, aves de corral, cabritos y actualmente ha construido un ambiente con comederos y bebederos en los cuales piensa criar cerdos de raza York (también conocidos como Large White). El alimenta sus animales con alimento balanceado, polvillo (producto derivado del arroz) y pastos naturales; cuando sus animales han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo el los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive.

José desea terminar de instalar sus corrales para empezar a criar sus cerdos de raza adecuadamente, de modo que estos se desarrollen correctamente, por este motivo el se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la realización de mejoras en sus corrales y en la compra de alimento balanceado.

José es una persona que gusta mucho del trabajo que realiza, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para así poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. En la zona en donde vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una persona honorable y de confianza.
texts.en:
José is 24 and is a father. He lives together with his family in the hamlet of San Pedro de Sasape, a rural sector in the Illimo district in Lambayeque province. The hamlet is located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. José has worked for approximately 5 years breeding and selling animals. He raises criole pigs, coop chickens, and goats. José has constructed an area with feeding troughs and drinking troughs where he is thinking about breeding York pigs (which are also known as Large Whites). He feeds his animals a balanced diet, including polvillo (a product derived from rice) and natural grasses. When his animals reach a good stage of development he sells them to businessman who also visit the zone where he lives. José wants to finish installing his corrals so he can start breeding his York pigs and let them develop correctly. To allow him to do this he is seeking a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for the first tim. This loan of 1500 soles will be used to make the improvements to his corrals and to buy balanced feed. José really likes the work that he does. His biggest dream is to continue growing as a businessman so that he can give his family a better quality of life. In the zone where he lives his neighbours and acquaintances consider him to be an honourable and trustworthy person.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve corrals and buy animal feed

location.town: Sector San Pedro de Sasape - Illimo - Lambayeque

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying pagne cloth and some fabrics for sewing clothing

loans.name: Miguel Jerónimo

texts.es: Miguel Jerónimo M. M. se dedica desde muy joven a la agricultura actividad que aprendió en el seno familiar. El invertirá el crédito en abono, braviado, rayado y semillas para la cosecha de maíz, frijoles, yuca etc.
texts.en:
Miguel Jerónimo M. M. has worked in agriculture since he was very young. learning it from his family. He is seeking a loan to invest in fertiliser, braviado, cuttings, and seeds so he can sow maize, beans, yuca etc.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilisers and seeds

loans.name: Gerarda

texts.es:
Gerarda, tiene 42 años, es casada, tiene tres hijos y vive en la ciudad de Urubamba. Su principal actividad económica es atender la tienda de comestibles de su hija. Su actividad económica complementaria es la venta de maíz pelado. Ella nos cuenta que los días miércoles, viernes y domingos compra maíz pelado en la feria de Sidrachayoc de Urubamba y después envía el maíz pelado a sus clientes que venden en la ciudad de Lima. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA” de la Asociación Arariwa y ella hace 6 años que participa en el banco comunal. Actualmente, ella requiere el crédito para comprar maíz pelado. 

Gerarda es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios de pre - grado. El anhelo de la socia es sacar profesionales a sus hijos y comprarse un carro donde pueda llevar sus productos.
 
Gerarda se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.  (En la fotografía la socia Gerarda está acompañada de su nieto Arturo).
texts.en:
Gerarda, 42, is married with 3 children and lives in the city of Urubamba. Her principle economic activity is working in her daughter's grocery store. Her complementary economic activity is the sale of peeled maize. Gerarda tells us that on Wednesdays, Fridays and Sundays she buys peeled maize from the Sidrachayoc market in Urubamba and later sends it to her clients in Lima, who then onsell it. Gerarda belongs to the communal bank 'SAYHUA', of the Arariwa Assocation, and she has been with the bank for 6 years. Gerarda is seeking a loan to purchase more peeled maize. Gerarda is a very hard-working and empresarial woman who always looks for opportunities to move forward and help her children with their pre-school studies. Her dream is that her children become professionals and to buy a car so she can transport her products. Gerarda is thankful for the opportunity granted by this loan and she promises to meet the payments within the stipulated time period. (In the photograph Gerarda is accompanied by her grandson Arturo).

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase peeled maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Fixing up his house

loans.name: San Rafael Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL”; Ellos son 15 miembros  alegres y trabajadores; los socios viven en la ciudad del Cusco y se reúnen una vez al mes en el local de Arariwa en el distrito de Huanchac departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Dolores, tiene 43 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos de 22, 18, 16, 12 años de edad  la socia alternando sus actividades del hogar se dedica  a prestar el servicio de llamadas a celulares y teléfonos fijos de forma ambulatoria, en el mercado de cascaparo  y todo el dinero que ingresa ella lo deposita la banco a plazo fijo y vive de los intereses, Nuestra socia recarga sus 3 celulares personales y los alquila a 0.50 céntimos el minuto a cualquier destino nacional, 

Nuestros otros socios se dedican en su mayoría a las llamadas de celular a celular y a las llamadas fijas desde celulares, son un grupo de amigos que tienen el mismo rubro. Nuestro socio el Sr Gabriel llegó después de la foto porque tenía permiso y llego atrasado al banco por lo que no aparece en este grupo.

Los socios agradecen el préstamo y se comprometen a seguir cumpliendo con el pago de sus deudas en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank 'San Rafael'. There are 15 happy and hard-working members. They live in the city of Cusco and get together once a month in the Arariwa area, Huanchac department, in Cusco. Dolores is 43 years old. She has 4 children - 22, 18, 16 and 12 years old. She alternates her activities in her home with her door to door phonecall service business, lending mobile phones and landlines. She deposits the money she earns in the bank and lives off the interest. Dolores recharges her 3 personal mobiles and rents them out at 50 céntimos per minute to all national destinations. The other members mainly work with mobile to mobile calls, and landline calls from mobile phones. They are a group of friends who have the same purpose. One member, Gabriel, arrived after the photo was taken because he had permission and arrived late to the bank. For this reason he isn't in this photo. The members are thankful for the loan and promise to continue meeting their debt repayments within the established time period.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Recharge mobile phones

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.es: Anastacia tiene 51 años, vive en su casa propia sola, pues sus tres jóvenes hijos estudian y viven en la ciudad, de vez en cuando la visitan. Cada día ella se despierta con el alba, para empezar con sus labores agrícolas, pues siembra habas, alverjas y papas, es así que todos los días cuida con mucha paciencia sus campos de cultivo. Para ella, la agricultura es un trabajo cansado pues pasa parte de la mañana en cuclillas, vigilando cada planta para que pueda obtener una buena cosecha, generalmente realiza la labor sola y cuando es tiempo de cosecha contrata operarios para que le ayuden a recoger todos sus productos maduros y luego venderlos a los mayoristas de la ciudad. Esta muy satisfecha porque las ganancias que obtiene de las ventas de su cosecha, le alcanzan para ofrecerles a sus hijos una buena educación en la ciudad, ya que su mayor anhelo es que lleguen a ser profesionales. Paralelamente a esta actividad, se dedica a la crianza de reses, en donde sus vacas le brindan varios litros de leche fresca diariamente. Mas adelante planea sembrar en mayor cantidad, tanto en alverja como en habas ya que quiere obtener mejores ganancias con las ventas de estas legumbres. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, además se siente satisfecho con el trabajo de su grupo pues todos los integrantes son muy puntuales en el pago de sus cuotas. Anastacia invertirá el crédito que solicita, en la compra de semillas de habas y alverjas, así como también fertilizantes y alquilar un tractor para que le ayude en  la próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Anastacia is 51 years old and lives by herself in her own home because her three teenage children study and live in the city. They visit her from time to time. Every day she wakes up at dawn to begin her work around the farm. She plants beans, peas, and potatoes and demonstrates great patience with her crops. Farming is tiring work for her because she spends part of her morning squatting and inspecting each plant to ensure she will have a good harvest. Anastacia generally works by herself, but when it is time to harvest, she hires workers to help with gathering all the mature produce that she will sell to the wholesalers in the city. She is very satisfied because the income she obtains from the sale of her crops allows her to provide her children in the city with a good education. Her greatest wish is for them to become professionals. In addition to farming, Anastacia raises cattle. Her cows provide several liters of fresh milk daily. In order to move forward, she hopes to plant more crops such as beans and peas so that she can generate better earnings from the sale of these legumes.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. Anastacia is content with the work of her group because all of the members are very punctual with their loan payments. She will invest her loan in the purchase of seeds for planting beans and peas, as well as fertilizers. Anastacia will also rent a tractor to help with her next planting.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds & fertilizers; pay for tractor rental

loans.name: Cristo Salvador Group

texts.es:
Miguel tiene una tienda en casa hace 8 años cuando empezó tuvo algunos dificultades con las ventas, después D. mucho esfuerzo sus ventas han mejorado y gana lo suficiente para subsistir, desea aperturar otra tienda que le permita dar trabajo a sus compañeros.
La tesorera Cecilia se dedica al negocio D. reciclaje hace mucho tiempo, este negocio le ha permitido la construcción D. su casa además la educación D. sus hijos, ahora tiene como objetivo la compra D. un local para su negocio.
Marlo es taxista hace 1 año alquila un auto para realizar este trabajo Aunque sabe que las calles son cada vez más peligrosas lo más importante es el bienestar y brindar lo necesario para su familia..
