G., trabaja como obrero en una institución, pero también tiene una pequeña parcela de tierra la cual siembra maíz en el invierno, tiene tres hijos en edad escolar los que tiene que preparar para el futuro, con este préstamo cubrirá unos gastos en la educación de sus hijos, les comprara también ropa para el colegio. Con los préstamos anteriores ha realizado siembras en su parcela y también ha cubierto unos gastos personales.
texts.en:
El señor C. G., trabaja como obrero en una institución, pero también tiene una pequeña parcela de tierra la cual siembra maíz en el invierno, tiene tres hijos en edad escolar los que tiene que preparar para el futuro, con este préstamo cubrirá unos gastos en la educación de sus hijos, les comprara también ropa para el colegio. Con los préstamos anteriores ha realizado siembras en su parcela y también ha cubierto unos gastos personales.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Educación de sus hijos y compra de ropa

loans.name: Kathiuska Alexandra

texts.es:
Kathiuska I. de 39 años, vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín (lugar originado por invasiones de terrenos particulares, lugar muy humilde con casas de caña y calles de tierra) de Guayaquil. Su casa es mixta de cemento y tablas solo tiene luz como servicio básico. Su esposo vende galones de agua, ellos tienen dos hijos de 14 y 6 años. 

Kathiuska para tener otro ingreso económico en su casa decidió comprar algunos víveres para vender. Adecuo una parte de su casa para hacer un local y su suegra le regalo algunos productos para que venda fue entonces que inicio con una tienda más surtida. 

Ella ahora trabaja todos los días, vendiendo azúcar, arroz, aceites etc. Pero ella quiere tener más productos en su tienda ya que la demanda es mucha. Por eso con el préstamo quiere comprar bebidas, azúcar, arroz para surtir más su negocio.   

En el futuro quiere vender productos y víveres al por mayor en almacenes conocidos, y que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Kathiuska I. is 39 years old and lives in the periurban district of Fortín in Guayaquil. This area was originally private land, but it is now a modest place full of dirt roads and houses constructed out of reeds. Kathiuska’s house is a mixture of cement and wooden planks and it receives electricity as its only basic service. Her husband sells water by the gallon. They have two children, ages 14 and 6.

Kathiuska wanted to generate additional household income, so she decided to buy a few provisions to sell. She set aside part of her house to establish a store and her mother-in-law gave her some products to sell so that her business could start out well-stocked. She now works every day selling sugar, rice, oil, and other items. Kathiuska wants to have more products in her store because there is much demand. For this reason, she is requesting a loan in order to buy beverages, sugar, and rice to increase the inventory of her business.

In the future, she wants to sell products and provisions in bulk out of recognized warehouses. She also wants to see her children finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beverages, sugar, and rice

loans.name: Wilde Evelio

texts.es:
El Sr. Wilde está casado con la Sra. Margarita hace varios años, tienen 4 hijos Menores que aún están cursando la escuela primaria.
Juntos montaron una despensa en su casa que esta ubicado  en un barrio muy poblado de la zona, se iniciaron con un pequeño capital que consiguieron con otros trabajos que han realizado anteriormente como asalariados. 
Además de la despensa tienen una actividad principal que es la de pasero (traslado de mercaderías del Brasil a Paraguay) y vendedor ambulante en la frontera, el señor es el  encargado de esa actividad ya que tienen más experiencia. 
Gracias al trabajo que están realizando Educan a sus hijos y compran todas las necesidades de su hogar. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de un vehiculo.
texts.en:
Sr. Wilde has been married to Sra. Margarita for several years. They have four young children who are enrolled in elementary school. Together they established a food pantry in their home, which is located in one of the most populated neighborhoods in the district. They started with a small amount of capital and continued to work other jobs as salaried employees.

In addition to the food pantry, Wilde has another business in which he works as a “pasero” (someone who transports merchandise from Brazil to Paraguay) and as a traveling merchant along the border. He is in charge of managing this business because he has the most experience. Thanks to his work he has been able to provide his children with an education and purchase all the household necessities.

He is requesting a loan to purchase a vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a vehicle for his traveling sales business

loans.name: Unidas En El Trabajo Group

texts.es:
En una oportunidad Yudi recibió la invitación  de una señora  para vender productos de belleza  al principio le pareció un trabajo difícil ya que nunca había vendido nada, pero se dio cuenta que en su barrio nadie ofrecia ese tipo de producto es así que empieza a vender entre sus vecinos,amigos y familiares. poco a poco le empiezan a comprar y  su clientela aumenta de modo que obtiene ingresos con los que ha podido ayudar en los ingresos familiares, tiene trabajando 3 años, le va muy bien por que cumple  y  entrega los pedidos a tiempo, aparte de dar  facilidades de pago a sus clientes.
Para el futuro quiere tener un bazar donde pueda ofrecer sus productos  a mucha gente, sabe que para lograrlo tiene que seguir ahorrando.  Yudi junto a 9 socias forman el grupo “UNIDAS EN EL TRABAJO” ella es la presidenta, tienen mas de 1 año juntas todas son comerciantes y vecinas del mismo lugar, ella invertirá su dinero del préstamo para comprar mas productos de belleza  para cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.

* Yudi esta con polo a rayas,en la foto aparece una señora mas como invitada.
texts.en:
Yudi was invited by a lady to sell beauty products. At first this seemed like a difficult job since she had never sold anything before, but she realized that no one in her neighborhood offered this type of product, so she began selling to her neighbors, friends and relatives. Little by little they started to buy from her, and her customer base grew so that she earns enough income to be able to help with household expenses. She has been working for three years, and it has gone very well for her because she fills and delivers her orders on time. She also offers credit to her customers. In the future she wants to have a store where she can offer her products to many people. She knows that to achieve this she has to keep saving. Yudi and nine other members form the "Unidas en el Trabajo" ("United in Work") group. She is the president. They have been together for more than a year. They are all businesswomen and neighbors. Yudi will invest her part of the loan in purchasing more beauty products to fill her customers' orders. * Yudi is in the striped shirt. Another woman also appears in the photo as a guest.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenecen al banco comunal “CRISTO MORENO”; Nuestro socio vive en la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socia es el Sr. Eduardo, el tiene 55 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos de 32, 30, 29, 22 años de edad, nuestro socio se dedica al comercio minorista, el socio es productor de escobas y el mismo las realiza en su casa taller, nuestro socio compra todos los materiales y las elabora con una máquina que le permite calibrar las medidas y que queden uniformes. Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales y de este modo continuar con su pequeño negocio y sacar adelante a su familia.

El socio agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Eduardo is a member of the Communal Bank “Cristo Moreno” and lives in the city of Cusco. He is 55 years old, in a common law marriage, and has four children (ages 32, 30, 29, and 22).

Eduardo has a small business manufacturing brooms from a workshop in his home. He buys all the materials and produces the brooms using a machine that calibrates the measurements so that they are all uniform. Eduardo is requesting a loan to buy materials so that he can continue his small business and move his family forward.

He appreciates and values the support that has been provided, and therefore promises to complete his payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials needed to make brooms

loans.name: Eyrá María

texts.es: La joven O. A., está solicitando este nuevo crédito en CEPRODEL para realizarle una remodelación a su casa, ya que se encontraba en mal estado y como se aproxima el invierno era necesario realizarlo en este momento. Es madre soltera, trabaja como cajera en un supermercado, se le han atendido dos préstamos antes de este, los que invirtió en compra de bienes del hogar (electrodomésticos) y gastos personales, tiene una hija que está a su cuido y la tiene estudiando.
texts.en:
La joven O. A., está solicitando este nuevo crédito en CEPRODEL para realizarle una remodelación a su casa, ya que se encontraba en mal estado y como se aproxima el invierno era necesario realizarlo en este momento. Es madre soltera, trabaja como cajera en un supermercado, se le han atendido dos préstamos antes de este, los que invirtió en compra de bienes del hogar (electrodomésticos) y gastos personales, tiene una hija que está a su cuido y la tiene estudiando.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Remodelación de su vivienda: compra de Ladrillos, cemento, arena, zinc, madera y otros.

loans.name: Nayibe Esther

texts.es:
Cuando Nayibe T. C., expresa que su negocio le ha dado a su familia la posibilidad de apoyar la educación de sus hijas y llevarlas a que sean profesionales produce  en cualquiera una inmensa satisfacción. Ella aprendió este oficio de su cónyuge quien por tradición familiar sabe mucho del arte de preparar las deliciosas empanadas, caribañolas y deditos, negocio del cual vive la familia y al que ha añadido venta de carnes, pescado vísceras y pollo, así como también frutas de cosecha. Ahora espera poder comprar un molino eléctrico y recipientes plástícos para moler el maíz,pues la tarea d emolienda la hace donde otra microempresaria y debe pagar por este servicio, así mismo quiere comprar su principal materia prima, "la yuca" para producir un mayor volumen de pedidos, esta es la razón por la cual aspira a su segundo crédito por valor de $1.100.000 y dice que desde el primero, cumple con mas tranquilidad los pedidos de sus clientes, no le debe a pagadiarios y siempre tiene para solucionar situaciones de emergencia

Nayibe vive en el barrio Loma Fresca en el suroccidente de Barranquilla, con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos,  la mayor esta por terminar su carrera universitaria y el menor estudia una carrera técnica, ahora su sueño es que sus hijos logren finalizar con éxito los estudios por eso ella y su cónyuge trabajan con mucho esmero. Su mayor desafío es trabajar en el reducido espacio donde desarrollan su actividad.
texts.en:
Nayibe T. C. experiences immense satisfaction when she says that her business has made it possible for her family to support her daughters’ education so that they can become professionals. She learned her trade from her husband, who has a family tradition of preparing delicious empanadas, caribañolas (dumplings made of cassava and potato dough, stuffed with meat and vegetables), and finger foods. Her family also sells meats, fish entrails, chicken, as well as harvested fruits. She now hopes to buy an electric mill and plastic containers for grinding corn. The task of milling and grinding is the chance to start another micro-enterprise since people are willing to pay for this service. Therefore, she wants to buy all the primary materials to get started. Nayibe also plans to buy cassava in bulk to grind into flour to fulfill orders. For this reason, she is requesting her second loan in the amount 1,100,000 COP. She says that after receiving her first loan, she was able to complete her customers’ orders more easily because she didn’t have to buy supplies every day and always had enough to address emergency situations. Nayibe lives in the Loma Fresca neighborhood in southwestern Barranquilla with her husband and two children. Her oldest daughter is finishing her college degree and the younger one is studying for a technical degree. She now dreams that her children will successfully finish their studies, so that she and her husband can see the fruits of their hard work. Her greatest challenge is working in a small space from which to develop her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cassava, an electric mill, and plastic containers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farming supplies

loans.name: Cristo Es El Camino Group

texts.es:
En esta Alcancía Comunal la mayoría de socias se dedica a la venta de tubérculos como es el caso de Olga que con la venta de tubérculos puede aportar con los gastos familiares y la educación de sus 2 menores hijos, ella es una mujer divorciada y tiene que hacer frente a los problemas que se le presenten. 
Felicita vende frutas hace varios años, aunque vende ambulatoriamente este negocio la ayudo a terminar la infraestructura de su casa y pagar la educación de sus hijos. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería que le permita obtener ganancias.
Los socios son puntuales en sus pagos, ellos desean mejorar la situación económica de sus familias. About EDAPROSPO: EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.
texts.en:
Most of the members of this Communal Bank sell tubers. This is the case with Olga. She sells tubers to pay the family expenses and to pay for her two minor children’s education. She is a divorced woman, and she has to deal with the problems they encounter. Felicita has been selling fruit for several years. Even though she is a street vendor, this business helped her finish the infrastructure of her house. It also helped pay for her children’s education. She will use the loan to buy merchandise that will allow her to get income. The members are punctual with their payments. They wish to improve their families’ economic situation. EDAPROSPO: EDAPROSPO seeks to use micro-credit to foster productive commercial activity for the sake of economic and social development within vulnerable urban and rural sectors traditionally neglected by commercial banks. By offering innovative products such as technical education loans and microfinance groups for young persons, EDAPROSPO helps disadvantaged Peruvians lift themselves out of poverty.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products and supplies

loans.name: Doris Felicitas

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “CRISTO MORENO”; Nuestra socia vive en la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. FELICITAS, ella tiene 64 años D. edad es casada y tiene 5 hijos D. 42, 38, 36, 29, 22 años D. edad, nuestra socia se dedica al comercio minorista, ella tiene una ferretería en su casa propia y atienD. desD. hace 15 años atrás, ahora le ayuda su esposo a atender el negocio él es jubilado y ella estudió una carrera técnica pero no lo concluyó debido a que se hizo cargo D. sus hijos desD. jovencita, su ferretería se llama Don Bosco. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales e implementar la ferretería.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member, Sra. Felicitas, belongs to the community bank "CRISTO MORENO” and lives in the city of Cusco. She is 64 years old, married, and has five children, aged 42, 38, 36, 29, and 22 years old. She is in the retail business, and has a hardware store in her own house. She has been serving for fifteen years, and now her husband helps her attend the business. He is retired and she studied a technical career, but she didn't finish it because she was in charge of the children since she was a young women. Her hardware store is called Don Bosco. She is requesting the loan to buy materials and to set up the hardware store.

Sra. Felicitas is grateful and values the support offered through these means, and she commits to complete the payment of her debt in the established time period.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She is requesting the loan to buy materials and set up the hardware store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Grass seed and wire for a fence

loans.name: María Nelly

texts.es: La señora S. B., trabaja como profesora de educación primaria en un colegio de Nagarote, tiene una hija que estudia en la universidad, solicita este nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en la reparación de la cocina de su casa, ya que se le pasa el agua y requiere darle mejores condiciones. Con los ingresos que recibe de maestra es difícil realizar esta inversión por lo que recurre a CEPRODEL para realizar esta mejora.
texts.en:
La señora S. B., trabaja como profesora de educación primaria en un colegio de Nagarote, tiene una hija que estudia en la universidad, solicita este nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en la reparación de la cocina de su casa, ya que se le pasa el agua y requiere darle mejores condiciones. Con los ingresos que recibe de maestra es difícil realizar esta inversión por lo que recurre a CEPRODEL para realizar esta mejora.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Reparación del techo de la cocina de la casa, compra de hojas de zinc, madera, clavos y otro.

loans.name: Maria Matilde

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “CRISTO MORENO”; Nuestra socia vive en la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. MATILDE, ella tiene 35 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos de 12 y 8  de edad, nuestra socia se dedica a la administración de sus propia discoteca ella tiene una discoteca en la av. La cultura llamada la choza, ella trabaja directamente en su negocio para ver la productividad y la calidad del servicio, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para incrementar su capital de trabajo.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Matilde is a member of the communal lending group “Cristo Moreno”, and lives in Cusco. She is 35, married and has two children aged 12 and 8 years. Matilde manages her own discoteque, called "La Choza" which is located on La Cultura Avenue. By working directly to grow her business in productivity and services, she seeks a loan to increase her operating capital. Mrs. Matilde is grateful for the support offered through micro-lending and is committed to paying the loan off according to the established terms and timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Cassetta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: loan to increase operating capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Construction materials

loans.name: Xiomara

texts.es: La señora C. P., es originaria del municipio de La Paz Centro y trabaja como profesora de una escuela de primaria, tiene dos hijas en edad escolar secundaria y en la universidad, con los prestamos que se le han atendido en CEPRODEL ha logrado irle realizando mejora a su casa, como también invertido en la educación de sus hijas, en este momento necesita instalar el piso de su casa, para darle mejores condiciones, pero solo con su salario no puede por lo que acude a esta institución para logar su objetivo.
texts.en:
La señora C. P., es originaria del municipio de La Paz Centro y trabaja como profesora de una escuela de primaria, tiene dos hijas en edad escolar secundaria y en la universidad, con los prestamos que se le han atendido en CEPRODEL ha logrado irle realizando mejora a su casa, como también invertido en la educación de sus hijas, en este momento necesita instalar el piso de su casa, para darle mejores condiciones, pero solo con su salario no puede por lo que acude a esta institución para logar su objetivo.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Instalación del piso de su casa, compra de ladrillos de piso, cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 29 años, es natural de la ciudad Urubamba y tiene un hijo. Ya es un año y medio que participa en el banco comunal.

Su principal actividad económica es vender ropa en el Centro Comercial "Señor de Sidrachayoc" de la ciudad de Urubamba. Ya son dos años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo.  Ella requiere el crédito para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo chompas, camisas, polos y muchas cosas más. 
 
Julia es una mujer trabajadora que busca a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario dar un mejor futuro a su hijo. El anhelo de la socia es tener su propia tienda de ventas de ropas. 

Julia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Julia has been a member of the communal lender “Sayhua” of the Arariwa Association for the past year and a half. She is 29 and lives in the city of Urubamba with her son. Julia's principal economic activity is selling clothing in the "Señor de Sidrachayoc" shopping center in Urubamba. She has managed this business for the past two years and has seen sales prosper through her efforts. She seeks a loan to buy varied clothing such as jackets, shirts, sports clothing and other marketable items. Julia is a hard worker that is constantly seeking opportunities to get ahead and offer a better future for her son. Her goal is to one day have her own clothing store. She is very grateful for the opportunity that micro-lending represents, and she is committed to paying off the loan in the timeframe specified.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Cassetta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Additional stock of marketable clothing items

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “CRISTO MORENO”; Nuestra socia vive en la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. GUADALUPE, ella tiene 35 años de edad es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 8 y 7  de edad, nuestra socia se dedica a la docencia, ella es profesora de primaria en un colegio y alterna sus actividades con el cuidado y atención de sus hijos y esposo; Nuestra socia nos comenta que tiene también una pequeña tiendita a la que le desea implementar un área de fotocopias, La socia solicita el préstamo para terminar de comprar la fotocopiadora.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member is an associate of the communal lender “Cristo Moreno” and lives in Cusco. Guadalupe is 35, married and has two children aged 8 and 7 respectively. She is a primary school teacher at a local school and takes care to balance her work responsibilities and those of caring for her family. Guadalupe runs a small store and would like to expand it to include photocopy services; to do so she seeks a loan to obtain a photocopy machine. Grateful for the support of micro credit lenders, Guadalupe is fully committed to repaying the loan in the established timeframe.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Cassetta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a photocopy machine

loans.name: Eli De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La señora Eli de los Ángeles C. Avendaño, es una persona  emprendedora dueña de un negocio de venta de perfume y electrodomésticos. El cual comenzó con un capital inicial de C$5,000.00 que lo adquirió producto de un préstamo hace 5 años. Este negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación. 
 El crédito solicitado es para invertir en capital de trabajo del negocio; como es la compra de pantalones, blusas, zapatos nacionales y cosméticos.
Es  casada, tiene un hijo a su cargo, actualmente se encuentra en el colegio. Dice que antes de tener este negocio ella Trabajaba en el mercado como vendedora en una abarrotería.

Lleva 7 créditos en  CEPRODEL a lo largo de 2 años los cuales ha invertido en su negocio con los que ha ido creciendo, diversificando sus productos para poder competir en el mercado, esto gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL.
texts.en:

El cual comenzó con un capital inicial de C$5,000.00 que lo adquirió producto de un préstamo hace 5 años. Este negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación. El crédito solicitado es para invertir en capital de trabajo del negocio; como es la compra de pantalones, blusas, zapatos nacionales y cosméticos. Es casada, tiene un hijo a su cargo, actualmente se encuentra en el colegio. Dice que antes de tener este negocio ella Trabajaba en el mercado como vendedora en una abarrotería. Lleva 7 créditos en CEPRODEL a lo largo de 2 años los cuales ha invertido en su negocio con los que ha ido creciendo, diversificando sus productos para poder competir en el mercado, esto gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL.

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “CRISTO MORENO”; Nuestra socia vive en la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. Mariluz,  ella tiene 38 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos de 11 y 7  de edad, nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el trabajo de lavar ropa de otras personas los fines de semanas, Nuestra socia es técnica en obstetricia pero por muchas diferentes razones no estaba ejerciendo su carrera, ahora ella está dispuesta a aperturar un consultorio obstétrico en su casa y el dinero que solicita lo invertirá en este nuevo proyecto.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our applicant is a member of the Cristo Moreno communal bank. She lives in the city of Cusco.

Sra. Mariluz is 38 years old and lives with her two children, ages 11 and 7. She alternates her household activities with a weekend job washing the clothes of other people. She is trained as a midwife but for a lot of different reasons has been unable to practice her profession.

Now, she has decided to open an obstetric office in her house, and she will invest the money she is applying for in this new project. Sra. Mariluz appreciates the support offered through the loan and promises to meet all her debt payments according to the established installments.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the opening of an obstetric office.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 55 años, es soltera, vive en casa de sus padres con sus hermanos. La actividad que tiene Luz, es el corte de cabello, peinados y la venta de cosméticos en general, por lo que se  esmera en hacer los cortes de acuerdo al gusto del cliente. Su salón de belleza esta ubicado en un pequeño espacio de su casa, donde la visitan muchos, en otras ocasiones es ella quien va al domicilio de sus clientes para que le den un especial atención. Ella disfruta mucho de su trabajo y más aún cuando vende sus productos de belleza, por que interrelaciona con sus fieles compradores. Aunque a veces este trabajo perjudica sus manos por los químicos que tiene, sin embargo vale el esfuerzo, con tal de aumentar su capital. Más adelante piensa dedicarse solo a la venta de cosméticos y realizar solo peinados. Este es su doceavo crédito con MFP, por lo que promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y del mismo modo trabajar responsablemente, ya que es la secretaria de su grupo. Con el crédito que solicita, piensa incrementar sus productos de belleza, cuanto más variada sea los cosméticos mayor serán las ganancias.
texts.en:
Luz is 55, single, and she lives in her parents’ home with her brothers and sister. Luz cuts and styles hair, and sells cosmetics in general. She goes to great pains with the haircuts to please her customers. Her beauty salon is located in a small space in her house where she takes care of many of her customers. Other times she goes to their homes to give them special attention. She really enjoys her work and especially when she sells her beauty products, because of the relationships she has developed with her loyal customers. Although occasionally the work hurts her hands with the chemicals that they contain, nevertheless it’s worth the effort because she can increase her capital. In the future she plans on only selling cosmetics and doing hairstyling. This is the twelfth loan with MFP, and she promises to make the payments on time and to work responsibly, because she is the group’s secretary. With the loan that she is requesting, she is planning on increasing her beauty supplies, since the bigger the variety, the more the profits.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics

loans.name: Heyling Judith

texts.es:
La señora Heyling Judith C. C., es una persona  emprendedora dueña de un negocio de venta de perfume y electrodomésticos. El cual comenzó con un capital inicial de C$7,000.00 que lo adquirió producto de un préstamo hace 5 años. Este negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación. 
 El crédito solicitado es para invertir en capital de trabajo del negocio; como es la compra de varios electrodomésticos y perfumen que le encargaron ya la mayoría de sus ventas son por encargos.

Es  casada sin hijos, de ella solo dependen sus padres con los que vive actualmente. Dice que antes de tener este negocio ella Trabajaba como docente de primaria.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Vehicle repair

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose Luis M.  es un señor de 55 años de edad que vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijas en una comunidad llamada San Ramón de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, Provincia de Cartago.  Es una pequeña comunidad rural. Sus pobladores se dedican a la producción de leche, la agricultura principalmente de café, plátano y también se da mucho la cría de cerdos. Tiene un relieve irregular y mucho del terreno se mantiene como bosque tropical húmedo. 
Don Jose  se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente a la siembra de Hortalizas como Banano, plátano y  cítricos. Dice que el mercado para este producto es muy bueno. Comenta que gracias a este proyecto sus condiciones de vida han mejorado considerablemente y dice además que ha crecido como persona y ha adquirido mucho conocimiento.
En estos momentos Don Jose desea obtener un microcrédito  por ¢605,000 (seiscientos cinco mil colones), para agrandar su plantación con una hectárea de Platano, darle mantenimiento, además comprar fertilizantes entre otros insumos. Con esta inversión  espera lograr una buena cosecha, con un producto de características apropiadas para conseguir un precio de venta alto poder incrementar la producción. 

Don Jose Luis es socio de la Asociación de Productores Agrícolas Ramonenses, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su tercer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Jose Luis M. is 55 years old. He lives with his wife and two daughters in a community named San Ramón de Santa Teresita de Turrialba, in the Cartago province. It is a small rural community whose members work in milk production, agriculture (primarily coffee and bananas), and the raising of pigs. It has an irregular coast, and much of its terrain is a humid tropical forest. Jose works in agriculture, specifically fruit and vegetable cultivation like plaintains, bananas and citrus. He says the market for these products is very good. Thanks to this project, he says his quality of life has improved considerably. He also says he has grown as a person and has acquired a lot of knowledge. Currently, Jose wants a micro-loan of ¢605,000 (six hundred and five thousand colones) to increase his plantation with a hectare of plantains and maintain it. Additionally, he wants to buy fertilizers among other input costs. With this loan, Jose plans to have a good harvest with produce that will obtain a high sale price, so he can increase production. Mr. Jose Luis is a member of the Association of Agricultural Producers of San Ramón, one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his third loan, and with it, he hopes to continue growing personally and economically and to participate actively in his community's loan organization.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying seeds and paying transport costs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve the conditions of his restaurant's premises.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.es:
Celsa pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 44 años, es natural de la ciudad Urubamba y tiene tres hijos. Ya es un año y medio que participa en el banco comunal.

Su principal actividad económica es vender pollos y pescado en el mercado central, Celsa vende desde las seis de la mañana hasta las tres de la tarde de lunes a viernes.  Su actividad económica complementaria es vender al por mayor verduras en el mercado de tito los días sábados. Ya son quince años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Ella requiere el crédito para comprar abono, insecticida y semillas para sembrar en su chacra.  El anhelo de la socia es sacar profesional a su hijo que está estudiando la carrera profesional de Ingeniería de agronomía. 

Celsa se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Celsa belongs to “SAYHUA” communal bank of the Arariwa Association. She is 44 years old, from Urubamba city and has three children. She has participated in the communal bank for one and a half years now. Her main economic activity is to sell chicken and fish in the central market. Celsa sells from six in the morning until three in the afternoon, Monday to Friday. Her other economic activity is to sell mainly vegetables in the Tito market on Saturdays. She has done this business for fifteen years and it is going very well. She needs the loan to buy fertilizer, insecticide and seeds to sow on her small farm. Her wish is to get her son, who is studying Agronomic Engineering, to be a professional. Celsa is grateful for the opportunity given in this means and she commits to the payments corresponding to the payment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Celsa needs the loan to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and seeds.

loans.name: Jorge Wili

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenece al banco comunal “CRISTO MORENO”; Nuestro socio vive en la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestro socio es el Sr. Jorge, Nuestro socio tiene 51 años de edad es casado y tiene 6 hijos de los cuale solo están bajo su cuidado 2 de 19 y 13 años, Nuestro socio es policía de turismo y como parte de ocupar su tiempo libre nuestro socio desea comprar cuyes e implementar un pequeño espacio para criar, Nuestro socio está aún en labor y trabaja con mucho amor y cariño a su institución, El socio solicita el préstamo para poder comprar cuyes y jaulas.

El socio agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Jorge belongs to the “Cristo Moreno” communal bank and lives in Cusco city. He is 51 years old and married with six children. Two of them, one of 19 and one of 13 years old are under his care. He is a Tourist Police Officer and to occupy his free time he wants to buy guinea pigs and to create a small space to breed them. He is still employed and works with much care for his institution. He wants the loan to be able to buy guinea pigs and cages. He is grateful and values the opportunity given by this means, and commits to completing the payment of his debt by the established deadline.

Translated from Spanish by Flavia Garcia, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy guinea pigs and cages.

loans.name: Guillermo José

texts.es:
El Señor Guillermo G. R., labora para el centro de insumos para la salud, el tiene a su cargo tres  hijos, dos de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar,  es casado, ha trabajado créditos con CEPRODEL durante 18 meses, en ese lapso ha invertido  dos créditos en la mejorar de las condiciones de su vivienda otorgados por CEPRODEL, el es una excelente Cliente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción para el cambio de piso de la vivienda en que habita, para darles una mejor condición de vida sus hijos.

texts.es:
La  Señor. EDGAR MANUEL L. Labora como Vigilante en la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua.
 El  tiene cinco hijo a su cargo, y estos se  encuentra en edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado dos créditos con CEPRODEL durante dos años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido dos créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

 El  tiene tres hijo a su cargo, y estos se  encuentra en edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado cuatro créditos con CEPRODEL durante cuatro años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido cuatro créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

texts.en:
La Señor. JAIRO ANTONIO M. G. Labora como Operario de Equipo en el M. Mayoreo de Managua. El tiene tres hijo a su cargo, y estos se encuentra en edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado cuatro créditos con CEPRODEL durante cuatro años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido cuatro créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL, el es un cliente excelente. El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc, clavos y perlines para el techo de su casa ya que viene la temporada de lluvia. Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: MEJORAS DE VIVIENDA Y AMPLIACION

loans.name: Jose Filemon

texts.es:
El Señor JOSE FILEMON M. C. Labora como Conductor en la Universidad Nacional de Ingeniería  (UNI) de Managua.
 El  tiene cuatro hijos a su cargo, y estos se  encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado siete créditos con CEPRODEL durante siete años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido siete créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Cemento, arena, hierro  y piedra para la construcción de un cuarto para su hijo mayor.
Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
El Señor JOSE FILEMON M. C. Labora como Conductor en la Universidad Nacional de Ingeniería (UNI) de Managua. El tiene cuatro hijos a su cargo, y estos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado siete créditos con CEPRODEL durante siete años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido siete créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL, el es un cliente excelente. El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Cemento, arena, hierro y piedra para la construcción de un cuarto para su hijo mayor. Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: MEJORAS DE VIVIENDA Y AMPLIACION

loans.name: Raymunda

texts.es: Raymunda tiene 51 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos menores. La actividad que realiza es trazar y cortar telas, en donde pone toda su concentración, ya que tiene que diferenciar y seleccionar las tallas de polos. La mesa de su comedor, es su herramienta de trabajo, sobre ella ejecuta los trazos sobre la tela a cortar. Ella se esmera en cortar las medidas exactas de cada pieza, en que luego son llevadas al taller de su amiga, para coser y remallar las prendas. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es diseñar, por lo que lleva 2 años trabajando de esta manera, siendo lo más difícil, no contar con el material apropiado para continuar trabajando. Para en el futuro, planea comprarse una maquina de coser e iniciar un taller de confecciones. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a pagar todas sus cuotas oportunamente, ya que será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su actividad. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará telas al por mayor para elaborar mayor cantidad de polos y cumplir con sus pedidos a tiempo.
texts.en:
Raymunda is a hard-working 51-year-old woman. She and her husband live in their own home with their three young children. Raymunda makes polo shirts for a living. At her dining room table, she traces patterns, cuts fabric pieces and sorts them. Raymunda does her best to cut every piece precisely, and then she takes them to her friend's shop, where they are sewn and finished. Her favourite part of her job is designing the shirts. She has been making shirts for two years; it's difficult work, and she doesn't have the right materials to continue doing it properly. In the future, she plans to buy a sewing machine and open her own clothing shop. This is her first MFP loan; she has agreed to make her payments on time, and considers it good for her business. Raymunda will use her loan to buy wholesale fabrics so that she can make more polo shirts and fill her orders on time.

Translated from Spanish by Corinne Gilroy, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying fabric for making shirts.

loans.name: Pablo Jose

texts.es:
El Señor PABLO JOSE M., Labora como Vigilante en el Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez de Managua.
 El  tiene tres hijos a su cargo, y estos se  encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado tres créditos con CEPRODEL durante tres años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido 3 créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: Cemento, piso y arena para su casa de habitacion.
Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

 El  tiene un hijo a su cargo, y este se  encuentra en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado tres créditos con CEPRODEL durante tres años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido tres créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.

La  Señora. MERCEDES G. Labora como Conserje en la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua.
 El  tiene cuatro hijo a su cargo, y estos se  encuentra en edad escolar, es madre soltera, ha trabajado dos créditos con CEPRODEL durante dos años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido dos créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: MEJORAS DE VIVIENDA Y AMPLIACION

loans.name: Emperatriz

texts.es:
Emperatriz pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 46 años, vive en la ciudad Urubamba y tiene cuatro hijos (Fredy, Jhordy, Naysha y Margarita). Ya es un año y medio que participa en el banco comunal.

Su principal actividad económica es vender pollos y pescado en el mercado central de Urubamba, Celsa vende desde las seis de la mañana hasta las seis de la noche de lunes a viernes. Ya son doce años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien. Ella requiere el crédito para comprar pollo y pescado. El anhelo de la socia es sacar profesional a sus hijos.  

Emperatriz se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Emperatriz belongs to the “Sayhua” Communal Bank in the Arariwa Association. She is 46 years old, lives in Urubamba city, and has four children (Fredy, Jhody, Naysha and Margarita). She has participated in the communal bank for a year and a half. Her business is selling chickens and fish in Urubamba’s main market, Celsa. She sells from six in the morning until seven in the evening, Monday through Friday. She has been in this business for 12 years and her business is going very well. She needs a loan to buy chicken and fish. Her goal is be enable her children to become professionals. Emperatriz is thankful for the opportunity provided through this loan and she promises to make her payments according to the time line.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chicken and fish

loans.name: Karla Maria

texts.es: La Sra. P. R. Karla, vive en Santa Dominguita, perteneciente al distrito de Santiago. Tiene un hijo, su esposo es cobrador del agua de la zona de Santa Dominguita. La Sra. Karla Trabaja como obrera de campo en las parcelas de la zona de santiago. Cuenta con casa propia a la cual le esta realizando acabados. Solicita el financiamiento para realizar acabados a su vivienda a fin de cumplir su sueño de brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. La Sra.  P. R. Karla, agradece el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Karla lives in Santa Dominguito, which belongs to the Santiago district. She has one child, and her husband collects water fees in the Santa Dominguita area. Karla is a field worker on the plots of land in the Santiago area. She has her own house, and she is working on finishing it. She is requesting the loan to finish her house. This will fulfill her dream of giving her family a better quality of life. Karla is grateful for the support that we are able to give her through this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve her house

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas forma parte del banco comunal “Sayhua” tiene 40 años, nació en la ciudad de Abancay, es casado y tiene tres hijos. 

Su principal actividad económica confeccionar ternos. Ya son 15 años que trabajan en el negocio y le va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en el trabajo.  Tomas es un padre responsable y emprendedor que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un  mejor futuro a sus hijos, el requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio desea comprar más materiales como por ejemplo telas, hilos y botones. El anhelo del socio es comprar maquinas industriales para implementar su taller.  

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente.
texts.en:
Tomas is a member of the “Sayhua” communal bank. He is 40 years old, was born in Abancay city, is married and has three children. His business is making suits. He has been in this business for 15 years and it is going very well thanks to the great effort he puts into his work. Tomas is a responsible father and businessman who always looks for opportunities to be successful and with his daily efforts provide a better future for his children. He needs a loan to increase the capital in his business as he wishes to buy more materials such as fabric, thread, and buttons. His goal is to buy industrial machines to install in his workshop. He is very grateful for the opportunity provided through this loan and he promises to make his payments according to the loan repayment schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more materials such as fabric, thread, and buttons

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.es:
Leonidas forma parte del banco comunal “Sayhua”, tiene 27 años y es soltero. 

Su principal actividad económica es vender accesorios personales como por ejemplo relojes, billeteras, etc. Ya es uno a dos años que trabajan en el negocio y le va muy bien gracias a su empeño que pone en el trabajo. Leonidas es un joven responsable y emprendedor que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario ayudar a su papa que está enfermo, él requiere el préstamo para aumentar el capital del negocio desea comprar más accesorios de personales como por ejemplo relojes, calculadoras, etc. El sueño del socio es tener su propia tienda de venta de accesorios.    

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente.
texts.en:
Leonidas is part of the community bank "Sayhua." He is 27 years old and single. His main economic activity is selling personal accessories, like watches, wallets, etc. He has spent between one and two years working in this business, and he is doing very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work. Leonidas is a responsible hard-working young man, who constantly looks for opportunities to get ahead in life and to help his sick father. Leonidas needs a loan to increase his working capital. He wants to buy more personal accessories like watches, calculators, etc. His dream is to have his own accessories store. Leonidas is very grateful for the opportunity offered through Kiva, and he promises to complete his loan repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying personal accessories to sell

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: La sra. Gladys A. R. de  22 años de edad, es conviviente tiene 1 hijo menor. Vive en casa de de sus cuñados ubicada en el Caserio Casablanca. Trabaja como obrera de campo en empresas agroindustriales. Es una persona emprendedora, que gracias a su empeño logró adquirir sus bienes. Requiere el crédito para terminar de construir su vivienda. Su sueño es lograr construir toda su vivienda con el fin de alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida. Esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Gladys A. R., age 22, is in a common law marriage and has one minor child. She lives in her brother-in-law’s house in the rural community of Casablanca. She is a field worker for agro-industrial businesses. She is a hard-working person, and thanks to her determination she was able to get her assets. She needs the loan to finish building her house. Her dream is to finish building her whole house in order to achieve a better quality of life. She is very grateful for the support we are able to offer through this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve her house

loans.name: Nohely

texts.es:
Nohely pertenece al banco comunal “SAYHUA” de la Asociación Arariwa, tiene 21 años, vive en la ciudad Urubamba y tiene un  hijo llamado Arturo. Ya es un año que participa en el banco comunal.

Su principal actividad económica es vender comestibles en su domicilio, ella acomodo una habitación de su domicilio para convertirla en una tienda de venta de abarrotes. Ella abre la tienda a las 5 de la mañana y cierra a las 10  de la noche. Ella es padre y madre de su hijo, es una madre joven, responsable y emprendedora que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un  mejor futuro a su hijo, ella requiere el crédito para comprar más comestibles como por ejemplo azúcar, fideos, arroz, leche, pan, etc. El sueño de la socia es sacar profesional a su hijo y estudiar una carrera profesional. 

Nohely se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Nohely belongs to the Arariwa Association's community bank "Sayhua." She is 21 years old. She lives in Urubamba. She has a son named Arturo. She has participated in the community bank for a year. Nohely sells food from her home. She converted a room to be a grocery store. She opens the store every morning at 5AM and closes at 10PM. She is father and mother to her child. She is a young, responsible, hard-working mother who constantly looks for opportunities to get ahead in a life and, with daily effort, give a better future to her son. She needs a loan to buy more food to sell, like sugar, pasta, rice, milk, bread, etc. Nohely's dream is to study a professional career and have her son become a professional. Nohely is grateful for the opportunity offered through Kiva, and she promises to make her repayments according to the timeline.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying food for sale: sugar, pasta, rice, milk, bread, etc.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: El Sr. Q. V. José Luis, vive en el caserio el siete, perteneciente al distrito de Pachacutec. Tiene a su cargo a su esposa Y 1 hijo. Su esposa trabaja de manera eventual en fundos agricolas. El Sr. Q.  trabaja como obrero de campo para el Sr. Nieto Rebatta Cesar Martin en el distrito de Pachacutec. Tiene casa propia. Solicita el financiamiento para el tarrajeo de su vivienda a fin de cumplir su sueño de brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. El Sr. Q. agradece el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Mr. Q. V. José Luis lives in the seventh village of the Pachacutec district. He is responsible for his wife and one son. His wife works on a casual basis in agricultural farms. Mr. Q. works as a field worker for Mr. Nieto Rebatta Cesar Martin in the district of Pachacutec. He has is own home. He requests funding for plaster to repair his home to fulfill his dream of providing a better quality of life for his family. Mr. Q. is grateful for the support to be provided with this funding.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Ngaeth

texts.en: Mrs. Ngaeth P., 48, is a villager who lives in Boeng Khpob village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she grows crops to earn for a living for her family. However, she does not have enough money to support her farming. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline to support her farm. Her husband, Mr. Kry Srin, sells candy to earn a small income to support his family. This couple has four children; one is a farm laborer, two are students who also support their mother's farm, while the youngest one is 2 years old. Her husband is on the right of the picture.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline.

loans.name: Mrs. Channy Loek Village Bank Group

texts.en: Twenty two people, who are part of this village bank loan, live in Kaoh Prah village in Kandal province. Mrs. Channy L. is a village bank president who has been selected by all the members, who will use their part of the loan for different purposes. She is a Chinese noodle seller in the local village, and earns some income to support her family. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it, but does not have enough money. Thus, Mrs. Channy L. decided to ask for a loan to buy ingredients. Her husband is a policeman and she has two children who attend the local public school.

loans.use: To buy ingredients.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
La Sra. Guillermina C. D. Vásquez, tiene 59 años D. edad. Se dedica a la crianza y venta D. pollos, patos y gallos D. pelea. Ella es casada. Su esposo percibe un ingreso mensual por su pensión D. jubilación. Viven en casa propia ubicada en el distrito D. Tate Camino GranD.. Su vivienda esta siendo lentamente reconstruida  con sus esfuerzos después del terremoto del año 2007. Ella es una mujer  muy emprendedora ya que no solo se ha dedicado a la crianza D. animales si no que también venD. comida. Con dichos ingresos ha educado a sus hijos  siendo actualmente personas independientes. Su sueño es construir totalmente su vivienda D. material noble, con el fin D. alcanzar una mejor calidad D. vida. Por eso está solicitando el préstamo. 

La Sra. C. se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo que le estamos brindando con este financiamiento.
texts.en:
Sra. Guillermina C. D. Vásquez is 59 years old. She raises and sells chickens, ducks, and fighting cocks. She is married, and her husband receives a monthly income from his retirement pension. They live in their own house in the Tate Camino GranD. district. Their house is slowly being reconstructed through their efforts since the 2007 earthquake. Sra. C. is a very entrepreneurial woman who not only raises animals but also sells food. With this income, she has educated her children, who are now independent people. Her dream is to totally construct their house out of good quality materials, with the goal of achieving a better quality of life. This is why she is requesting a loan. Sra. C. is very grateful for the support that is offered her through this financing.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Mejoramiento de vivienda

loans.name: Srey

texts.en: Mrs. Srey C. is 53 years old and is a villager who lives in Kandal Kaoh Touch village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a 1-hectare field where she cultivates ginger and garlic. In this farming, Mrs. Srey C. faces a problem because she does not have enough money to support her farming. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy ginger seed and garlic seed, and the rest of the loan she will use to buy a water machine to support her farming crops. Her husband, Mr. Phornsy Meach, is a construction worker who earns a small salary to support his family. This couple has a child who is a seamstress in a garment factory. Her husband is on the left of the picture.

loans.use: To buy ginger seed and garlic seed and buy a water machine to support her farming crops.

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en: Mrs. Lorn P., 49, lives in Angk village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice, and she also breeds pigs. She can earn a small income from both businesses to support her family. Mrs. Lorn P. is now requesting a loan to buy rice seed to support her farming and the rest of the loan she wants to use to buy a pig for breeding. Mrs. Lorn P. is a widow with four children:  two are farm laborers, and two are students in the local school and also support their mother's business.

loans.use: To buy rice seed to support her farming and to buy a pig for breeding.

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom T. is a 29 year old married woman and she is a villager who lives in Check village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Kim Art, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they cultivate rice to earn a living for their family.

However, they face a face a problem because they do not have enough money to support the rice field. Thus,Mrs. Mom T. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline to support her farm crops. Mrs. Mom T. is a mother of two children who all are too young to study or work. Her husband is on the right of the picture.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline.

loans.name: Mr. Sros Chhun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of eighteen people who live in Kaoh Prah village in Kandal province. Mr. Sros C. is a village bank president who has been selected by all the members, who will each use the loan for different purposes. He is a construction worker, who earns a low income T. support his family. His wife, Mrs. Seynat V., is a farmer who owns a very small piece of land where she cultivates rice T. also support her family.

In the rice field they have a problem because their field is far from an irrigation system, but they do not have enough money. Thus, Mr. Sros C. decided T. ask for a loan T. buy a hose, and he wants T. use the rest of the loan T. buy two bicycles for his education and transportation T. work for the children. He is a father of six children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the other three are enrolled in the local public school, and the other is too young T. work or study.

On the day of the loan disbursement Mr. Sros C. was busy working. Instead, his wife, Mrs. Seynat V., received the loan for him. The phoT. above is of Mr. Sros C.'s wife.

loans.use: To buy a hose for irrigation.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa C., 46, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. She is married to Alex C., an assistant pastor who also does welding jobs during the weekdays. They are blessed with six children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life. She has been direct selling food supplements, clothing and cosmetics for quite some time now.

Elsa has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT)* for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her direct selling business.

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a 12,000 Philippine peso loan. This money will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business to buy advance orders of food supplements, clothing and cosmetics from her direct selling line. She dreams that her business will continue to grow and be successful.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy advance orders of food supplements, clothing and cosmetics from her direct selling line

loans.name: Mrs. Srey Mao Pai Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of nineteen people who live in Samar village in Kandal province. Mrs. Srey Mao P. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. They will each use their loan for different purposes. She is a farmer, who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice to sell to support her family.

However, she has a problem because her rice field is infertile. Thus, in order to improve her rice production, Mrs. Srey Mao P. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer. Her husband, Mr. Socheat Rous, owns a plow machine, and she has three children who are all enrolled in the local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth N. is from the village of Casinglot, Tagoloan, Misamis Oriental. She is 46 years old. Elizabeth is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Elizabeth owns and operates a business venture in the food sector running a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling specialty food products in the local community. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 8,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elizabeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Elizabeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and to better support her family.

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en:
Byambasuren C. is 40 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  He and his family live together in a ger (the Mongolian nomadic tent). His wife, Arvinaa, is a civil-service employee and Byambasuren operates a trucking business in his town. He has been operating his business since 2007, and has gained a lot of experience in previous years. 

He is located in one of the biggest food markets called Huchit Shonhor, and transports packages to and from many areas. Byambasuren sometimes does soldering work for extra income. When he does soldering, his son drives the truck. He has been planning to expand his soldering business in the future. 

Byambasuren says, “I would like build a large house for my family and to make it possible for my children live on their own.” 

He is requesting a 700,000 tugrug loan to purchase four tires and other spare parts for his truck.

loans.use: To purchase tires and other spare parts

loans.name: Shiilegsuren

texts.en: Shiilegsuren is 29 years old and lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Shiilegsuren is a very hardworking person. She is requesting a loan to increase her working capital. About Credit Mongol: Credit Mongol’s mission is to contribute to the prosperity of Mongols by providing diversified financial services to micro-loan and small and medium enterprise (SME) clients and to become the best-performing company in micro-loan and SME financing in Mongolia.

Leelawathi is a 58-year-old unmarried woman living in the town of Telijjawila in the Matara area of southern Sri Lanka.

Leelawathi has managed a rice paddy cultivation business for a long time with the help of her brother. 

She has requested a 30,000 LKR loan from BRAC to help her with the rice paddy cultivation.  She is a very active, honest, and hard working woman. She is grateful to BRAC Sri Lanka for the financial support it provides to her.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy equipment for her rice paddy

loans.name: Mrs. Sokha Shaem Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan consists of eight people who live in Lech Pram village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sokha S. is the village bank president, selected by all the members. They will use the loan for different purposes. She and her husband, Mr. Thy Teb, are farmers who own a plot of land to grow crops to support their family. They have some problems because their field is ready to grow, but they do not have enough money to support the field. Thus, Mrs. Sokha S. decided to ask for a loan to buy vegetable seeds, fertilizer and pesticide. This couple has no children.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seeds, fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Oyuntsetseg

texts.en:
Oyuntsetseg is 34 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a small house which they own. Her oldest son and daughter attend a high school.
Oyuntsetseg operates a business trading second-hand products, such as shoes, at Narantuul market, the largest and most crowded market in the city. She started her business in 2003 and has had steady growth over the years. Today, her working capital exceeds 5,000,000 tugrugs (approximately 3,590 USD) and her daily profits average between 15,000 and 20,000 tugrugs (approximately 10 to 15 USD).
Over the years, Oyuntsetseg has gained great business experience and she has used her earnings to support her family and grow her business. She is very hard-working and hopes to continue her success in the future.
Oyuntsetseg’s oldest sister is an invalid. Her sister has three children but they don’t have a house to live in. Oyuntsetseg wants to build a new house for her sister. She says, “I love my sister so much. She is a very patient person. My dream is to purchase a larger house for my sister’s family.”
Oyuntsetseg is requesting a loan to purchase construction materials to build the new house for her oldest sister.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to build the new house

loans.name: Bunthorn's Group

texts.en: In Preak Ta Choar village in Kandal province, there are four people who make a group loan. Mrs. Bunthorn T. is the group leader who has been selected by all the members. They will use the loan for different purposes. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to grow bananas to sell to support her family. Although she tries to work hard with her field, she cannot earn enough income, because her soil is infertile and it is far from an irrigation system. Thus, Mrs. Bunthorn T. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline to support her banana field. Her husband, Mr. Ritha Mou, is a teacher who gets a small salary to support his family. She has two children who are enrolled in local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Srey Pao's Group

texts.en: In Spean Dek village in Kandal province, six people make up a group loan. Mrs. Srey Pao A. is the group leader who has been selected by all the members. They will use the loan for different purposes. She owns a general store in the local village to earn some money to support her family. Since her business is going well she wants to expand it. Thus, in order to improve her business, Mrs. Srey Pao A. decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries. Her husband, Mr. Rea Den Dieb, is a policeman and she has three children. One of her children is a government worker, one is an employee of a private company, and one attends the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer H. took a loan from FATEN to help her husband improve and expand his meat shop. Abeer is a mother of five daughters and four sons; one of them has already graduated and works in the United Arab Emirates while the rest are school and university students.

Abeer's husband, Jala, started his business twenty years ago. He sells frozen and fresh meat and chicken which he prepares at his own shop.  Jalal is thinking of expanding his business and purchasing a bigger fridge to include selling fish and expanding his business in order to cover his family expenses.

Jala's shop is well-known and is located in the market of Jenin city where you can see him in the picture above preparing chicken for one of his customers, who is standing next to him.

loans.use: Purchasing a bigger fridge

loans.name: Mrs. Sokha Phatt Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan has nine people who live in Tuol Sala village in Kandal province. Mrs. Sokha P. is the village bank president. She has been selected by all the members. They will use the loan for different purposes. She sells honey door to door. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand. Thus, Mrs. Sokha P. decided to ask for a loan to buy more honey to resell and to buy electric supply to support her house. Her husband, Mr. Oret Nub, is a farmer who owns 0.5-hectare of land to cultivate rice to support his family. She has four children. Two of her children are seamstresses in the garment factory and two attend the local public school.

loans.use: To buy electric supply

loans.name: Wijdan

texts.en:
Wijdan Y. who works with her husband, Iqab, in the fields wants to share in helping him improve their field which is their only source of income, so she took a US$ 2000 loan from FATEN. In their free time, Wijdan and her sons work with Iqab, taking care of the plants he grows.

The family consists of five sons who are between 22 and 2 years old. Wijdan and Iqab have a greenhouse and would like to purchase another one to increase the produce and be able to grow a larger variety of fruits and vegetables every season, therefore she came to FATEN.

The couple are known in the city of Jineen for their commitment to work and their ambition. Jineen is a city which is known for farming and agriculture and it supplies the Palestinian market with a huge amount of vegetables and fruits.

Iqab appears in the field in the picture above.

loans.use: Purchasing a greenhouse

loans.name: Anngie

texts.en:
Anngie S. is from the village of Lilingayon, Valencia City. She is 29 years old. Anngie is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Anngie owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling a variety of different products in the local community. Anngie has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Anngie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anngie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Anngie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.name: Muyassar

texts.en:
A. Muyassar is 49 years old. She is married and has two children. Muyassar, together with her husband, has a business making dairy products and selling them to groceries, market stands, and local neighbors in their community. Muyassar is telling us that day by day, her children are growing up and their expenses are rising too. She always dreamed her children would be well educated and she is doing the best she can to realize her dream. So she is very motivated to succeed in her daily and weekly sales goals. Now Muyassar feels that with additional capital she can increase her sales and profits. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of $2,700 USD. Let’s get behind this dedicated mother to make her dreams become reality.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make dairy products

texts.en:

He works his land with love and dedication every day, so that it produces excellent vegetables. Nasibdjon has been in agribusiness for about ten years. In fact, he draws strength and vitality to make his products the best in the city. Though growing vegetables is a very difficult and time-consuming job, he hopes to gather a rich harvest. He is planning to fix the house and save enough money for the well-being of his family. For this purpose he is requesting a loan of 5,000 Somoni. With the desire to realize his plan, Nasibdjon appeals to your generous hearts for a swift contribution.
