Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda C. is from the village of Kalasungay, Valencia City. She is 53 years old. Luzminda is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Luzminda owns & operates a specialized retail store selling firewood and charcoal in the local community. Luzminda has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Luzminda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Luzminda is requesting a  loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Luzminda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar M. and her husband share the responsibility of providing for their four children, whose ages range from one to six years old. Maricar has her own small hog-fattening business, which she established with a loan from Kiva partner, ASHI, in 2009. Her husband drives a tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) for transportation that he rents from a neighbor.
The income earned by the couple is not enough to give their children enough proper food for their nourishment. They can only buy the cheapest and most common food in the market and their locality. Therefore, Maricar wants to obtain a larger amount of capital through a loan to grow her hog-fattening business. She wants to fatten and sell a large volume of hogs in the market to earn more profit, which will be used to improve her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase pigs for fattening

loans.name: Momela Group

texts.en:
Rock M., aged 47, is married with three children aged 15, 17 and 21. He has been selling second-hand clothes since 2007. He works from 8.30am to 7pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $221 USD.
This will be Rock’s second loan from Kiva partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. He used his previous loan to increase his stock, and has paid back this loan successfully. He is requesting a new loan to increase his business stock. Rock will share this loan with his group, Momela, which totals 19 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.
In the picture, Rock is the man third from the left in the center row.

loans.use: To increase his business stock

loans.name: Joao Miguel

texts.pt:
João Miguel U. nasceu na cidade de Inhambane, Província do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, tem 46 anos de idade, casado e pai de 2 filhos de 23 e 02 anos de idade, a filha mais velha esta na Republica da África do Sul, casou se e reside lá. Fez 3°ano de Universidade em electrónica. Vive numa casa de aluguer com a sua família e sustenta sua sobrinha que vive com ele.
Saiu de Inhambane para a província da Beira em missão de serviço, em 2009 é transferido para Maputo. Trabalha no Ministério da Defesa como engenheiro electrónico ha mais de 30 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário de 11.957.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda consegue poupar algum na sua conta Bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de colegas de serviço que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 16.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, varões de ferro, areia e tinta e outros) para reabilitar a sua antiga casa no Bairro da Machava.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para a continuar com a reabilitação da sua casa e iniciar um projecto nos seus dois terrenos no bairro de Bobole e Mulotane.
texts.en:
João Miguel U. was born in Inhambane City, Inhambane Province in southern Mozambique. He is 46 years old, married and the father of two children, ages 23 years and 2 years. The elder daughter, who is married, lives in South Africa. He finished three years of university study in electronics. He lives in a rented house with his family and supports a niece who lives with him. João left Inhambane when he was transferred to Beira Province for work, and in 2009 he was transferred to Maputo. For more than 30 years he has worked for the Ministry of Defense as an electronic engineer. He has no employees and has a salary of 11,957 meticais per month, which he uses for household expenses while managing to save some in his bank account. He has never had loans from other banks. He learned about Hluvuku through co-workers who are also customers of this institution. This is his first loan. He is asking for 16,000 meticais, which he will use to buy construction materials (cement, iron bars, sand and paint and other items) to renovate his old house in Machava neighborhood. João promises to pay off this loan on time so he can take out other loans. In the future he would like to ask for more loans to continue renovations on his house and to begin a project on his two plots in Bobole and Mulotane neighborhoods.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, iron bars, sand and paint and other items)

loans.name: Amelia Solequile

texts.pt:
Amélia Soliquile T. nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique tem 41 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 4 filhos de 15, 12, 7 e 4 anos de idade, os três mais velhos vão a escola. Fez somente 5ą classe não continuou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua familia e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Nunca saiu do seu bairro natal, vive com a sua família no Bairro de Mahubo. Tem um negócio próprio ha mais de 17 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 2.000.00mt a 3.000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua casa porque não possui conta bancária.
Ja teve empréstimos em outros bancos TCHUMA, mais tarde decidiu não continuar devido a vários motivos. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 10.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (cervejas, refrescos, vinhos, arroz, óleo e outros) para aumentar a quantidade de sua mercadoria. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 4.000.00mt e 8.500.00mt, para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro, gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar na melhoria do seu estabelecimento comercial.
texts.en:
Amélia Soliquile T. was born in the district of Boane, Maputo province, in southern Mozambique. She is 41 years old, married, and is the mother of 4 children who are 15, 12, 7, and 4 years old. The three oldest go to school. She only finished the 5th grade; she did not continue due to a lack of financial means. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anybody else. Amélia has never left the neighborhood where she was born; she lives with her family in the Mahubo sector. For more than 17 years, she has had her own business. She does not have any employees and she earns about 2,000 MZN to 3,000 MZN per month, which she uses to pay for household expenses. She even saves some in her house, as she does not have a bank account. She has had loans with others banks, for example TCHUMA. Later she decided not to continue with them for various reasons. She found out about Hluvuku through friends. This is her 3rd loan, which has a value of 10,000 MZN. She plans to use it to buy products (beer, refreshments, wine, rice, oil, etc.) in order to increase her merchandise stock. The previous loans were for 4,000 MZN and 8,500 MZN, which she used for the same purpose. She promises to pay off the loan on time so she will be able to have access to others. In the future, she would like to ask for more loans to improve her business establishment.

Translated from Portuguese by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell products (beer, refreshments, wine, rice, oil, etc.)

loans.name: Mr. Chek Chin Village Bank Group

texts.en: Fourteen people who live in Toul Sala village in Kandal province, make up this group who are requesting a village bank loan. They will use the loan for different purposes to improve the living conditions of their families. Mr. Chek C. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. He is a fisherman who can earn some money from selling fish. His wife, Mrs. Channy Thy, is a laborer. Now they have a problem because their house is dark, so it is difficult to live in. Thus, Mr. Chek C. decided to ask for a loan to buy some electricity to supply to his house. He is a father of three children, two of whom are enrolled in local public school, while the other is only four years old.

loans.use: To buy electricity service to their home.

loans.name: Miraluna

texts.en:
Miraluna B. is from the village of Waterfall, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 38 years old. Miraluna is married and has 2 young children. Miraluna owns & operates a business providing transportation services with the use of their own motor vehicle. Her husband is the driver of the said vehicle. Their business operates for over 6 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Miraluna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Miraluna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. Miraluna decided to request a new loan of 13000 PHP which will be used to purchase needed materials to provide more better service and motor vehicle maintenance.This will be the 7th loan taken out by Miraluna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase needed materials to provide more better service and motor vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Virginia Enoque

texts.pt:
Virgínia Inoque C. nasceu na cidade da Matola, Província de Maputo, Sul de Moçambique tem 29 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 3 filhos de 11, 09 e 02 anos de idade, os dois mais velhos vão a escola. Fez somente 5ą classe não continuou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu da Matola para o Distrito de Boane quando contraiu o seu Matrimonio ha 14 anos. Vive com a sua família neste Distrito e desenvolve o seu negócio desde a sua chegada. Não possui nenhum empregado e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 2.000.00mt a 3.000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda com ajuda do seu marido que trabalha no Ministério da Saúde poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que também são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 3º empréstimo no valor de 11.500.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, ferro, areia e, óleo e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua residência. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 6.000.00mt e 9.000.00mt, todos para a mesma actividade. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro, gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar na conclusão da sua casa.
texts.en:
Virgínia Enoque C. was born in Matola City, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is 29, married, and the mother of three children, ages 11, 9 and 2. The two elder children go to school. Virgínia only finished fifth grade and did not continue school because of financial difficulties. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else. She left Matola to move to Boane District when she married 14 years ago. She has lived in this District with her family and run her own business since her arrival here. She has no employees and earns about 2,000 to 3,000 meticais per month, which she uses for household expenses. With the help of her husband, who works for the Ministry of Health, she saves some money in their bank account. Virgínia has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through friends who are also customers of this institution. This is Virgínia's third loan. She is asking for 11,500 meticais, which she will use to buy construction materials (cement, iron, sand and oil and other items) to continue construction on her home. The earlier loans were for 6,000 meticais and 9,000 meticais, both for the same purpose. She promises to pay off this loan on time so she may take out other loans. In the future, she would like to ask for more loans to finish building her house.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (cement, iron, san and oil and other items)

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma M. is from the village of Old Damulog, Damulog Bukidnon. She is 37 years old. Gemma is married and has 6 school-aged children. To make a living, Gemma owns & operates a business selling health & medicinal products in the local community. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gemma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & towards working capital. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Gemma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Mrs. Ngoar Surn Village Bank Group

texts.en: This group loan from Tep Archun village in Kandal province consists of 9 members, who will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Ngoar S. was selected by the other members as the village bank president.  She is a mother of three children; two are laborers, while the other is attending a local public school. She and her husband are farmers who own more than 1 hectare of land, on which they cultivate rice to support their family. They have some problems with their rice field because the soil is infertile and it is far from an irrigation system. Thus, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline, and a hose.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline, and a hose

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina C. is from the village of Salvacion, Kadingilan Bukidnon. She is 42 years old, married, and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Rufina owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Rufina has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rufina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rufina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rufina is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be Rufina’s 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Marta Fernando

texts.pt:
Marta Fernando M. nasceu no Distrito de Guija, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique tem 46 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 5 filhos de 28, 24, 20 e gémeos de 14 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez somente 6ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta uma irmã que vive com ela.
Saiu de Guija para Ndlavela arredores da cidade de Maputo com os seus pais ainda muito jovem. Depois do seu casamento decidiu iniciar uma actividade comercial para ajudar nas despesas de casa. É vendedor ambulante ha mais de 14 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 6.000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seu cunhado que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 12.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (cimento cola, tijoleira, e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa. O empréstimo anterior foi de 8.000.00mt também para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro, gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar na ampliação do seu negócio e concluir a sua residência.
texts.en:
Marta Fernando M. was born in Guija District, Gaza Province in southern Mozambique. She is 46, married, and has five children, ages 28, 24, 20 and 14-year-old twins. All the children go to school. Marta finished sixth grade but did not continue because of financial difficulties. She lives in her own house with her family and supports a sister who lives with her. She left Guija for Ndlavela, on the outskirts of the city of Maputo, with her parents when she was very young. After her marriage, she decided to start a business to help with household expenses. For more than 14 years, she has been a traveling salesperson. She has no employees and earns around 6,000 meticais monthy. She uses this money for household expenses and saves some in her bank account. Marta has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through her brother-in-law, who is also a customer of this institution. This 12,000 meticais loan is her second. She will use it to buy construction materials (adhesive cement, bricks and other items) to continue construction on her house. The earlier loan of 8,000 meticais was used for the same purpose. She promises to pay off this loan on time so she can take out other loans. In the future, Marta would like to ask for more loans to use for expanding her business and finishing her house.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (adhesive cement, bricks and other items)

loans.name: Mrs. Ngaeth Kol Village Bank Group

texts.en: This group loan from Tep Archun village in Kandal province consists of 10 members, who will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Ngaeth K. was selected by the other members as the village bank president.  She is a mother of five children; one is a chef, while the others are attending a local public school.  Her husband is also a chef, while she is a farmer who owns more than 2 hectares of land on which she grows crops that she sells to support her family. She has some problems with her crop field because the soil is infertile and it is far from an irrigation system. Thus, she has decided to apply for a loan to buy fertilizer, gasoline, and vegetable seeds.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, gasoline, and vegetable seeds

loans.name: Maria Lee

texts.en:
Maria Lee B. is from the village of Salvacion, Kadingilan Bukidnon. She is 32 years old, married, and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Maria Lee owns & operates a tailoring business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing general  alteration & tailoring services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately  earns 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Maria Lee joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles, thread and fabric. Maria Lee is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fabric & materials. This will be Maria Lee’s 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family’s income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabric & materials

loans.name: Sor

texts.en: Sor S., 24, is married, and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for clay and ceramic products. She is employed at a local garment factory for an income of about 2.5 USD per day. Her husband is an electrical engineer, earning an income of 4 USD per day to help cover the family’s expenses.  S. is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to repair her house.  This is her third loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia. S.'s husband appears in the photograph.

loans.use: to repair her house

loans.name: Purita

texts.en:
Purita A. is 63 years old and has enjoyed her career as a wife, mother and businesswoman. Despite being poor, she is happy for the opportunities she has had and she has worked hard to achieve her dreams in life. The loan that Purita took when she became a member of Kiva partner, ASHI, in 2009 was used to start up a small hog-fattening business. The profits she earned were used to augment her husband's income as a farmer and provide for her family's needs. She is now requesting a larger loan to finance her plan for expanding her hog-fattening business. She wants to fatten more pigs and sell them together, either alive or slaughtered. In this way, she will be able to increase her profit and make her cash flow a bit more fluid, which will improve their life.
Purita’s two eldest children are college undergraduates and work as hired laborers in different small private companies in the province. Once her business becomes stable, including its profit, Purita’s youngest child can be sent to college and graduate from her chosen course.

loans.use: To purchase piglets for fattening and selling

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda W. is from the village of Nes Visayas, Kibawe, Bukidnon. She is 46 years old. Erlinda is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Erlinda runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Erlinda has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Erlinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Erlinda is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the third loan taken out by Erlinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Felismina

texts.pt:
Felismina S. nasceu no Distrito de Moamba, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique tem 57 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de 4 filhos de 35, 30, 27 e 23 anos de idade, todos já não vão a escola. Fez somente 3ą classe não continuou porque os pais não tinham condições financeiras e priorizaram mais trabalho de produção de comida. Vive na casa própria com os seus filhos e sustenta 2 sobrinhos que vivem com ela.
Saiu de Moamba para Maputo devido a Guerra de desestabilização que assolou também aquele Distrito. Tem um negócio próprio há mais de 20 anos, possui 1 empregado que lhe auxilia no seu negócio e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 20.000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum nas suas contas bancárias (Millenium Bim e Standard Bank).
Já teve empréstimos na Associação de crédito Malengane, mais tarde decidiu não continuar. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigas que já são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (carne, temperos, arroz, refrescos, cervejas, e outros) para aumentar e diversificar ainda mais a sua mercadoria. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. Um dos seus maiores projectos é inaugurar o seu novo estabelecimento e oferecer cada vez mais melhores serviços a sua clientela. Pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar no desenvolvimento do seu negócio.
texts.en:
Felismina S. was born in Moamba District, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is 57, widowed, and has 4 children who are 35, 30, 27 and 23 years old. None of them are going to school. Felisima only finished third grade and did not continue because her parents could not afford it and focused more on work that produced food. She lives in her own house with her children and supports two relatives (nieces or nephews) who live with her. She left Moamba for Maputo because of the civil war that also ravaged that District. For more than 20 years, she has had her own business. She has one employee who helps her with her business, and she earns about 20,000 meticais per month. She uses this for household expenses and even saves some in her bank accounts (at Millenium Bim and Standard Bank). Felisima has had loans before with Malengane Credit Union, but she decided not to continue with them. She learned about Hluvuku through friends who are also customers of this institution. This 25,000 meticais loan is her first; she will use it to buy products (meat, spices, rice, soft drinks, beer, and other products) to increase and diversify her merchandise. She promises to pay off this loan on time so she can take out other loans. One of her biggest projects is to open her new shop and offer better service to her customers. She intends to ask for more loans to use for the growth of her business.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of products (meat, spices, rice, soft drinks, beer and other products)

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Lay N., 38, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for clay and ceramic products. (N.'s husband appears in the photograph.)

She sells groceries for an income of about $7 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of $6.90 per day to help cover the family expenses. N. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. 

In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: Buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov C., 37, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for clay and ceramic products. 

She buys lotus seeds for sale for an income of about $7 per day. Her husband sells sugarcane juice, earning an income of $3.50 per day to help cover the family expenses.  

C. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more lotus seeds for resale. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to support her children’s studies. This is her fifth loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: Buy more lotus seeds for resale

loans.name: Mrs. Heng Chom Village Bank Group

texts.en: This bank loan group consists of eleven people who are villagers in Boeng Leu village in Kandal province. Mrs. Heng C. is the group president, selected by all the members who will use the loan for different purposes. She and her husband, Mr. Dara Vanna, are farmers who own a five-hectare plot of land to grow rice and corn to sell to support their family. Their problem is that their field is a long way from the irrigation system. So to improve production, Mrs. Heng C. is asking for a loan to buy a hose and rice and corn seed. The couple has three children, two of whom are in local public school, while the other is one year old.

loans.use: To buy a hose and rice and corn seed

loans.name: Yeke

texts.en:
Yeke D. is from the village of Salvaion, Kadingilan Bukidnon. She is 38 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Yeke has a business providing hairdressing and beauty services to local community members. Yeke has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Yeke joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase needed materials. Yeke is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This will be the third loan taken out by Yeke from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand services offered

loans.name: Sandya

texts.en:
Sandya is a 32-year-old married woman living in the town of Kekanadura in the Matara area of Sri Lanka. She has two sons and her husband works as a mason. Sandya has managed a business sewing clothes and selling them to local customers for three years. She has requested a 30,000 LKR loan from BRAC Sri Lanka to help her business by purchasing cloth.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy cloth for a sewing business

loans.name: Jose

texts.pt:
José A. nasceu na cidade da Beira, Província de Sofala, centro de Moçambique tem 44 anos de idade, casado e pai de 4 filhos de 14, 12, 09 e 06 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Fez somente 8ą classe não continuou porque foi incorporado para o serviço militar obrigatório. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu da Beira para Maputo cumprindo com o serviço militar em 1986, veio sozinho mais tarde constituiu sua família em Boane. Depois da desmobilização entrou no Ministério do Interior afecto como motorista, não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário de 7.820.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária (Barclays).
Já teve empréstimos no Banco Millenium Bim, mais tarde decidiu não continuar. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que já são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 4º empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção (tintas, tijoleiras, cimento e outros) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa. Os empréstimos anteriores foram de 7.700.00mt, 12.000.00mt e 14.500.00mt todos para a mesma actividade.  
Um dos seus maiores projectos é concluir a sua residência para oferecer melhores condições de Habitabilidade a sua família. Pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para aplicar na conclusão da sua obra.
texts.en:
José was born in the town of Beira, in the Sofala Province, in Central Mozambique. He is 44 years old, married and the father of 4 children who are 14, 12, 9 and 6 years old. All of the children go to school. He only went to school until the 8th grade. He wasn't able to finish school because he was drafted for military service. He lives with his family in his own house and doesn't support anyone else. He left Beira to go to Maputo after completing his military service in 1986. He moved there alone and later established his family. Upon completing his military service he started working for the Ministry of the Interior as a driver. He doesn't have any employees and earns 7.820.00mt per month, which goes towards household expenses. He manages to save some money in his savings account (Barclays Bank). He has requested a loan with Millenium Bim Bank and later decided not to continue to request loans. He came to know Hluvuku through friends who were already partners of the institution. This loan, in the amount of 25.000.00mt, is his fourth. The previous loans were for 7.700.00mt, 12.000.00mt and 14.000.00mt, all invested towards the same goal. One of his biggest goals is to finish his house in order to provide better living conditions for his family. He intends to request more loans to invest in finishing his house.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of building materials (paint, bricks, cement and others)

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie C. is from the village of Watefall, Balingasag Misamis Oriental. She is 30 years old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Rosemarie has a business making and selling food products, primarily meats. Rosemarie has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Rosemarie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosemarie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the tenth loan taken out by Rosemarie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Bikamwa Plus Group

texts.en:
Bikamwa Plus is a Community Bank made up of 26 members whose chairwoman is Véronique. These members are united for the same goal: to grow their businesses by loans received from Kiva through the MFI HOPE RDC. 

Véronique sells corn and manioc flour. She began her business in 2000. After hard work and good management, she succeeded in making it thrive, thanks to the accumulated profits. Véronique is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having five times obtained and correctly repaid loans. She will increase her stock of merchandise with her next loan by buying ten 10kg/sacks of corn and manioc flour and reselling them at a profit. Véronique is 60 years old. She is married and the mother of 6 children, whose ages range between 8 and 35 years old. Only one of her children attends school. Her business generates a profit of $35 per week. Véronique’s dream is to open a manioc and corn facility and become a provider in her area.

loans.use: Towards purchasing 10 10kg/sacks of corn and manioc flour and reselling them at a profit

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice S. is from the village of Salvacion, Kadingilan Bukidnon. She is 51 years old. Alice is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Alice owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling a variety of different products in the local community. Alice has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Alice joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Alice has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & towards working capital. Alice is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Alice from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda V. is from the village of Waterfall, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 70 years old. Yolanda is married. To make a living, Yolanda owns & operates a specialized business selling bamboo products like nipa and others in the local community. Yolanda has been engaged in her business for over 35 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Yolanda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Yolanda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Yolanda is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 9th loan taken out by Yolanda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Mrs. Korn Lang Village Bank Group

texts.en: There are ten people who are make up this village bank loan. They live in BoE. Leu village in Kandal province. They will use this loan for different purposes so that it can improve their businesses. Mrs. Korn L. is the village bank president who has been selected by all the members. She is a farmer who owns 0.5-hectare of land to grow vegetables to sell to support her family. In the vegetable field she has some problems because her field has infertile soil and it has a lot of insects. Thus, in order to improve productive vegetables, Mrs. Korn L. has decided to seek a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides. She is a widow with three children, one of whom is a laborer. The other children are studying in a local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Nicolau Azarias

texts.pt:
Nicolau Azarias Dgedge nasceu no Distrito de Chibuto, Província de Gaza, sul de Moçambique tem 47 anos de idade, casado e pai de 5 filhos de 18, 15, 09, 05 anos de idade e o ultimo com 2 meses de idade, os três mais velhos vão a escola. Fez somente 8ą classe não continuou porque foi incorporado para o serviço militar obrigatório. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.
Saiu de Chibuto para Boane a procura de melhores condições de vida. Tem um negócio próprio ha mais de 5 anos, possui três empregados que lhe auxiliam no seu negócio e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 7.000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de amigos que já são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar material de construção para revenda (chapas de zinco, cimento, pedra e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para poder desenvolver o seu negócio.
texts.en:
Nicolau Azarias was born in the Chibuto District, in the Gaza Province, in South Mozambique. He is 47 years old, married and the father of 5 children who are 18, 15, 9 and 5 years old and the youngest is 2 months old. The oldest three children go to school. He only went to school until the 8th grade and didn't because he was drafted for mandatory military service. He lives with his family in his own house and doesn't support anyone else. He left Chibuto to go to Boane looking for a better life. He has had his own business for more than 5 years and has 3 employees who help him. He has an income of around 7.000.00mt per month, which goes towards household expenses and he still manages to save some money in his savings account. He has never requested loans with other banks. He came to know Hluvuku through friends who were already partners of the institution. This loan, in the amount of 25.000.00mt, is his first and he intends to buy building materials for resale (zinc screens, cement, stone and others) in order to increase his inventory. He is committed to paying this loan on time in order to be able to request other loans. In the future, he would like to request more loans to develop his business.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of zinc screens, cement, stone and others

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza D. is from the village of Omonay, Damulog Bukidnon. She is 39 years old. Flordeliza is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Flordeliza owns & operates a specialized retail store where she sells mango and guava fruits in the local community. Flordeliza has been engaged in her business for over 1 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Flordeliza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Flordeliza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & towards working capital. Flordeliza is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Flordeliza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.pt:
Glória Azarais M. nasceu na cidade da Matola, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique tem 33 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 5 filhos de 16, 13, 11, 9 e 5 anos de idade, todos vão a escola. Frequenta 9ą classe no curso nocturno porque na altura não teve possibilidade devido a falta de recursos financeiros. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta 2 sobrinhos que vivem com ela.
Saiu da cidade da Matola para o bairro da Matola rio depois de se juntar ao seu marido no ano 2000. Tem um negócio próprio a mais de 10 anos no quintal da sua própria casa, não possui nenhum empregado e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 3.500.00mt a 4.000.0mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de seu irmão que também é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (cerveja, refrescos, sumos, bolachas e outros) para aumentar e diversificar ainda mais a sua mercadoria. O empréstimo anterior foi de 15.000.00mt para a mesma actividade.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para poder aplicar no melhoramento do seu negócio como forma de ajudar o seu marido nas despesas de casa.
texts.en:
Glória was born in the town of Matola, in the Maputo Province, South of Mozambique. She is 33 years old, married and the mother of 5 children who are 16, 13, 11, 9 and 5 years old. All her children go to school. She is in 9th grade of night school because she couldn't finish school due to lack of financial resources. She lives in her own house with her family and supports two nephews who live with her. She left the town of Matola to the Matola Rio district upon moving in with her husband in 2000. She has had her own business in her backyard for over 10 years. She doesn't have any employees and has an income of 3.500.00 to 4.000.00m per month, which goes to household expenses and she manages to save some money in her savings account. She has never had loans with other banks. She came to know Hluvuku through her brother who is also a partner of the institution. This loan, in the amount of 20.000.00mt is her second. She intends to purchase merchandise (beer, sodas, juices, cookies and others) to increase and diversify her inventory. The previous loan was for 15.000.00mt and invested in the same activity. She commits to paying this loan on time in order to be able to be granted other loans. In the future, she would like to request more loans to improve her business as a way of helping her husband with household expenses.

Translated from Portuguese by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of products (beer, sodas, juices, cookies and others)

loans.name: Yellow Group

texts.en:
O. I., age 26, is married with one son, age one and a half years. He has had a general store since 2008 and is able to earn a monthly profit of around $1166. 

This will be O.’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the loan, he hopes to increase the stock of his general store. O. will share this loan with his group, comprised of 15 other men and women from his community. They work in food sales and retail sales. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. 

In the picture, O. is first from the left, near the car, with a white cap.

loans.use: To increase his general store stock

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth W. M. is twenty-three years old. She is married and her husband is a supermarket attendant. They have two children for whom they hope to provide quality education.

Elizabeth's business is located at Thika and is well known by the name Wamaisha grocery. She sells kale, tomatoes, pineapples, onions, bananas and other groceries, mostly to women and bachelors who live in the locality. She has been in this business for the last three years. She says the business is good and the only major challenge they have is harassment from the local government. 

She works very hard to ensure her business is doing well, and she says that she gets some financial support from her husband. However, this financial support is not enough and that is why she is taking a loan of 20,000 KES to buy more groceries to expand her business. 

Elizabeth has many plans for the future which include constructing a family house, building her own business premises and starting a retail shop to increase her income. She is hardworking and sociable.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul Kinyanjui K. is twenty-one years old. He is single and has no children yet. He provides motorcycle transport in the Kiganjo area in Thika. Kiganjo is mainly a busy residential area in Thika.  Paul's business is well known by the name Boda Boda-Kimuchu. He has been in this business for three years now and he plans to buy another motorbike to grow his business. That is why he is requesting a 20,000 KES loan. 

Paul has plans to purchase land, find a wife, have children and build a house for his family. He is very hardworking and he is determined to meet his goals in life.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Enrequita

texts.en:
Enrequita S. is from the village of Waterfall, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 45 years old. Enrequita is married and has 10 school-aged children. To make a living, Enrequita owns & operates a specialized retail business selling a variety of products such as green bananas, chorizo, toccino, firewood and many more in the local community. Enrequita has been engaged in her business for over 13 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Enrequita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Enrequita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. Enrequita is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 7th loan taken out by Enrequita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en:
Boniface M. N. is forty-one years old. He is married and has two children for whom he hopes to provide quality education. 

His business is located at Thika town. Thika is well known for its large scale production of pineapples. It is a fast growing medium-size town in Kenya. 

Boniface has been selling passion fruit for the last eight years to the local people. He says that business is good and the only challenge at times is getting the fruit to the market during the rainy seasons, which render the roads impassable. 

He is taking out a loan of 20,000 KES to buy more fruit to expand his business. He wants to grow his business to a point where he can export the fruit. He is hardworking, patient and humble.

loans.use: To buy more passion fruit to sell.

loans.name: Mrs. Sary Yan Village Bank Group

texts.en: There are eight people, living in Boeng Leu village in Kandal province, who make up this village bank loan. They will use the loan for different purpose in order to improve their businesses in the future. Mrs. S. Y. is the village bank president, as selected by all the members in this village bank loan. She and her husband, Mr. S. An, are farmers who own 4-hectare of land to grow rice to sell so they can support their family's living costs. They are diligent and yet still, they can earn little income because their field has infertile soil and it is far from any irrigation system. In order to improve the family's living conditions, Mrs. S. Y. has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and a pump machine. Through this activity, they can support three children, two of whom are laborers, while the other is attending a local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and a pump machine.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie J. is from the village of Macapari, Damulog Bukidnon. She is 48 years old. Lanie is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Lanie owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail sho selling a variety of different products in the local community. Lanie has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lanie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Lanie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lanie is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Lanie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support the education of her children. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Luke

texts.en: Luke is 33 years old and married with two children who are in school. He sells furniture such as wall units, tables and sofa sets in his home town to earn a living. He has been in the business for seven years and has two employees. Luke also earns some extra income from teaching income generating activities to the youths from his church. He saves his money with his group in Faulu Kenya called Wangige Business Pioneers. This enables him to access loans because the group guarantees repayment. He hopes to grow his business and venture into other businesses in the future. He has requested for a loan of KES 20,000 form Faulu Kenya to buy more furniture to sell.

loans.use: To buy more furniture to sell.

Nergincita has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.
