The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock onions and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is a 42-year-old married man, and has four school-going children. He operates a carpentry business in Nairobi, Kenya. He has been operating this business for four years, and he says that the business environment is favorable. He has three employees, and he sells his wares to his neighbors. He is a member of the Sunshine self-help group, whose members have guaranteed him a loan of Kes. 40,000 from Faulu Kenya. He plans to add stock of timber for furniture manufacturing with the loan money. He describes himself as being hardworking and faithful.

loans.use: To add stock of timber

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en: Samuel is 58 years old and is married with three children who go to school. He is mainly into farming business, but also does carpentry work under construction to earn a living. He has been in the business for 10 years and has one employee.  He grows vegetables and rears and fattens pigs to earn enough money to support his family, and pay the school fees for his children.  He saves his money with his group in Faulu Kenya called Mwimuto Success, which enables him to access loans because the group guarantees. He hopes to grow his farming business into large scale and improve his living standards in the future. He has requested for a loan of kes 40,000 from Faulu Kenya to buy manure, fertilizer, seeds and super growing chemicals for his farming business.

loans.use: To buy manure, fertilizer, seeds and super growing chemicals for his farming business.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
La Sra. Elsa Jimenez tiene 50 años de edad, esta casada con el  Señor Antonio Benitez hace ya 32 años, tienen cuatro hijas juntos, todas mayores y profesionales a quienes criaron con mucho sacrificio ya que son personas muy humildes y trabajan de forma independiente.
La Sra. Elsa se dedica a la venta comidas típicas del Paraguay como Pastel Mandi'o (Empanada de Mandioca) hace 25 años en el Mercado Municipal Nº 2 de Coronel Oviedo, comenta que aprendió a realizar el producto con mucha delicadeza de su madre. Ella ayuda y apoya económicamente a su marido para la manutención de la casa y la educación de sus hijos.
Vende mas de 300 empanadas por la mañana porque tiene su clientela formada y la popularidad de buena calidad de su producto. 
Ella manifiesta su conformidad con la Fundación Paraguaya porque es la primera institución quien le otorgo un préstamo por el tipo de actividad que realiza, la cual valora y agradece.
Solicita el prétamo para la compra de ingredientes como; harina, huevos, aceites, carnicos y verduras.
texts.en:
Mrs. Elsa Jimenez is 50 years old and has been married to Antonio Benitez for 32 years. They have four daughters, all of whom are adults and working professionals, and they raised them with a lot of sacrifices, since they are very humble people and work independently. Elsa makes a living selling typical Paraguayan foods, such as Pastel Mandi'o, which she has done for the last 25 years in the town market of Coronel Oviedo. She learned how to make the product with a lot of gentleness from her mother. With her earnings, she helps and supports her husband economically for the maintenance of their house and the education of their children. She sells more than 300 empanadas each morning, because she has an established clientele and is popular due to the good quality of her product. Fundacion Paraguaya is the first institution to grant her a loan for the type of activity that she performs, for which she is very grateful. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of ingredients such as: flour, eggs, oil, meat, and vegetables.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase flour, eggs, oil, dairy products, meat, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en: Maureen is married to a builder and they have four children. All the children are going to school. Maureen takes care of additional family members. She rents and lives in a two-room house where she stays with the family. Maureen deals in African attire and batiks, a business she is proud of. She sells all types of bitenge (African attire) and sells to all categories of people at both retail and wholesale. Besides this clothing business, she also sells local ghee.  She has been doing these businesses for many years. Her business challenges include seasonality and transportation of clothes from shops. She sells by moving door to door. Maureen wants to use this loan to buy more African attire and ghee.  She aspires to see her business grow bigger, to start going to the Democratic Republic of Congo and to own a permanent business premise.

loans.use: To buy more African attire and local ghee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is a 40 year old businesslady who sells clothes and shoes as well as fruits. She has been running this business for four years and describes her business environment as favourable. She sells her wares to area residents. She hopes to become an importer of clothes and to have a well established boutique. 

Patricia is a member of a group under Faulu whose members guarantee each other's loans. She is requesting a second loan of 40,000 Kenyan Shillings to add stocks of clothes and shoes as well as buy a table. She describes herself as a hard-working woman who is ready to achieve more. Patricia is married and is a mother of five.

loans.use: Add stock of clothes, shoes and a table

loans.name: Flor

texts.es: Flor tiene 56 años, es madre de 5 hijos mayores, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo. Su actividad cotidiana de Flor, es la venta de ropa y calzados, negocio que le dedica todas las tardes, yendo a las casa de sus clientes llevando la mercadería previamente solicitada y al cabo de 15 días empieza con la cobranza. Está contenta con el trabajo que realiza, sobre todo por la modalidad negocio que hace, permitiéndole captar mayores ganancias, además le da la facilidad de disponer su tiempo, ya que así puede apoyar a su esposo en el alquiler de maderas, puesto que él es albañil. Lo que más le atrae de su oficio, es apreciar la diversidad de prendas que obtiene, sin embargo hay mercadería que no logra vender, de esta manera es que ha logrado trabajar por más de 15 años en este negocio. En adelante le gustaría tener su galería de ropa en su casa y no tener que salir a ofrecer. Este es su doceavo crédito con MFP y renueva su compromiso de seguir pagando como hasta ahora. En su grupo solidario es una compañera muy responsable y preocupada por el bienestar y el desarrollo de su actividad. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará edredones y cubre camas al por mayor, para así cumplior con el pedido de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Flor is 56 years old, the mother of 5 grown-up children, and lives in her own house with her husband. Her daily activity is selling clothing and shoes, a business to which she devotes her afternoons, going to her clients' houses with the requested merchandise. After 15 days have passed, she begins collecting payments. She is content with her job, because it allows her to earn a good income and also provides her with free time. Therefore, she is able to help support her husband, who is a bricklayer. The thing that most attracts her to this trade is appreciating the diversity of the garments that she obtains. However, there is merchandise that she cannot manage to sell. Despite this, she has worked in this business for over 15 years. In the future, she would like to have a clothing store in her house, so she doesn't have to go out to sell her merchandise. This is her twelfth loan with MFP, and she renews her commitment to continue making her payments as she has done up to this point. In her solidarity group, she is a very responsible partner and concerned for the well-being and development of her activity. With the loan she is now requesting, she will purchase comforters and bed sheets wholesale, in order to fulfill her clients' requests.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bed sheets and comforters

loans.name: Ermida

texts.es:
La Sra Ermida tiene 45 años D. edad, esta casada  con el Sr. Jose B. D. 53 años D. edad, es comerciante, posee una despensa  bien surtida hace aproximadamente 13 años, tiene cuatro hijos.
La Sra. se dedica a la venta D. productos D. la canasta familiar, ademas D. bebidas, merceríasy ademas ella elabora bocaditos por pedido. 
Su marido es constructor realiza trabajos por cuenta propia.
Ella llego  a la Fundación Paraguaya a través D. promociones realizadas en el barrio, nos solicito apoyo para comprar mas mercaderías puesto que tiene muchos clientes, así pudo adquirir harinas, huevos, leche, queso, panificados,carnes, pollo, embutidos, golosinas, carbón, etc. 
La Sra. y toda su familia agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya y a Kiva por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Ermida is 45 years old and married to Mr. Jose Baez, who is 53 years old, and they have four children together. She is a merchant who has owned a well-stocked store for 13 years. She sells common products, such as drinks, and also makes snacks by request. Her husband is a building contractor who performs jobs independently. Ermida came upon Fundacion Paraguaya through promotions in her neighborhood, and she requested support to purchase more merchandise, since she has a lot of clients. In this way, she was able to obtain flour, eggs, milk, cheese, bread, meat, chicken, candy, etc. Ermida and her family thank the Fundacion Paraguaya and Kiva for the support they have provided.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase flour, rice, noodles, bread, chicken, milk, eggs, candy, soft drinks, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Yesu Amala Development Group, Mpigi

texts.en:
A certain adage holds that a wise man’s day is worth a fool’s life. It’s a proverb M. Paul, a 30 year old bachelor, has been holding dear for the last six months while he has been operating his small stationery business in Kyasanku, Mpigi. He strains and sweats his guts out every single day knowing he has to improve his status quo. He is one who rises with the lark and plans for his day as early as 4 a.m.

Paul has an openhanded line of conduct and this has played into his hands as he operates. He is as good humored as they come and he stresses this is the reason why he has struck a profound chord with most of his clients. In a month, he says, he makes profits to the tune of 250,000 shillings. With this loan, his blueprint plans of setting up an Internet café, he says, are on the cards.

Paul has one child and two dependents under his care.

loans.use: To purchase more stationery items like reams of paper

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is 34, married, and has two children who go to school. She bakes Maandazi (African doughnuts) and prepares uji (porridge) for sale in Nairobi to earn a living.  She also sews clothes to earn extra income since the living costs are high in the capital city.  Her customers are mostly the area residents who keep on returning because of her good customer care skills.  

She saves her money with her group in Faulu Kenya which enables her to access loans. She hopes to grow her businesses now that she can access loans and this is her second loan. She had previously taken out a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) from Faulu Kenya which she used to expand her business and she successfully repaid.  She has requested for a loan of 40,000 KES from Faulu Kenya to add stock of flour, sugar, sewing materials and a sewing machine. She hopes to open a restaurant and tailoring premises in the future.

loans.use: Flour and sugar; sewing materials and a sewing machine.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothes and shoes to sell
